programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Southampton v Hull City at St Mary's Stadium and Crystal Palace v Burnley at Selhurst Park. The Tigers and Eagles were both looking to boost their chances of avoiding relegation, although Hull's abysmal away record saw them start as underdogs against the Saints for their trip to the south coast.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: Round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs, and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents moral and religious discussions on topical issues, with contributions by members of the studio audience.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and Charles Hanson assist two teams searching for antiques in Wetherby, West Yorkshire. Presenter Anita Manning observes their progress and also has a pow wow about a tiny toy pooch.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A basement flat in London's Peckham, and terraced houses in Cadishead near Manchester and Maerdy in Wales are all sold under the hammer. Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners to hear their plans to add value to their auction buys.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: The Rutland family tries to decide whether to move to Australia, with Julie hoping that a trial week in Perth will be the key to convincing reluctant husband Dan to take the plunge. Nicki Chapman presents.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: David Fletcher and Anita Manning appraise collectibles at Alnwick Castle in Northumberland, valuing items including Murano glass figurines and a Newcastle shipyard visitors' book. Paul Martin also explores the building's State Rooms, learning about the Percy family's tastes.(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine presents a selection of viewers' comments on BBC shows, a chance to see memorable clips, and an insight into what goes on behind the scenes of new programmes.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a couple with a budget of £325,000 look for their first marital home in the rural Lake District. Whilst their, Jonnie learns about the marine life of Windermere.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Josie D'Arby celebrates the 30th anniversary of the Cornish Air Ambulance Service and attends a cheerful church service in London.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a celebrity version of the general knowledge quiz, featuring four teams of stars from the 1970s. The contestants are Pan's People dancers Dee Dee Wilde and Babs Powell, boxer John Conteh and footballer Alan Mullery, Blake's Seven stars Michael Keating and Jacqueline Pearce, and Martin Lee and Sandra Stevens from Brotherhood of Man.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison visits Warwickshire for Hedgehog Awareness Week, and meets three girls who have set up a rehab centre for the animals. Steve Brown meets local volunteers trying to preserve wildlife along the river Tame and its floodplain, and John Craven visits a nature reserve that doubles as a burial ground. Adam Henson meets a farming family in Cumbria and Tom Heap explores Scotland's salmon industry.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head for the attractive gardens of Trelissick, near Truro in Cornwall. Objects under examination include a bust of Winston Churchill found at the bottom of a lake and a group of medals owned by a proud grandson. A lifebelt tells the graphic story of a shipwreck off the Lizard peninsula in which the crew were rescued in desperate circumstances.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Nick faces lengthy questioning before being charged with Tim Ifield's murder. The AC-12 team is convinced Roz was also involved, but with Hastings coming under pressure from Hilton, the detectives are running out of time to prove their theory, and are forced to risk everything to bring the guilty parties to justice. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, which featured Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal, Everton v Chelsea, Manchester United v Swansea City and Middlesbrough v Manchester City. Spurs finally seem destined to finish above their north London rivals, and victory would be even sweeter as it would harm the Gunners' chances of a top-four finish.(n)

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the latest FA WASL Spring Series fixtures, including Sunderland v Arsenal.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: New series. Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville return to investigate more consumer issues, beginning by meeting people who have money stolen from bank accounts.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of a flat in Little Chalfont, Buckinghamshire, a maisonette in Oldham and a terraced house in South Norwood, south-east London.(n)

programme.title: The Wanted
programme.desc: The Serious Organised Crime Group tracks down a gang of armed robbers, the Xcalibre team discovers a cannabis farm and PC Lockwood attempts to extradite a fugitive back to Poland.(n)

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: An American woman is caught planning her husband's murder by an undercover police officer posing as a hitman, and British Transport Police catch up with a trio of fraudsters.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In an hour-long edition, experts Charles Hanson and Paul Laidlaw help a team of cycling fans and a group of motorbike enthusiasts search for bargains in Lincolnshire. Presenter Tim Wonnacott stumbles across a compelling find, and pays a visit to the Geffrye Museum in London.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Susan Calman hosts the quiz in which one contestant is put in control and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which of the other players is best suited to answer.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple hoping to move to rural south Somerset after 18 years without a garden, and finds out about the latest refurbishment project at the Rural Life Museum.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Dave and Harry Rich head to Watford, Hertfordshire, where they come up with ideas for a couple who want a space to remind them of their former garden in Africa.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms and then sells three things about to be dumped at a tip, before giving the profits to the people who were getting rid of the items.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden v Danny Sebastian Foreign Antiques Market.
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Danny Sebastian go antique-hunting in Annecy, south-east France, where Jonty unearths a Salvador Dali etching and Danny finds a vintage sewing table.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Matt Baker and a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals get under way with the nine remaining contenders facing just one test to keep themselves in the competition. They have 90 minutes to cook dishes showcasing their favourite ingredients, with their choices including lamb, cauliflower and seaweed, before one of the hopefuls is eliminated.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle begins her community service, and while Ian and Sharon show their support, Louise, Madison and Alexandra do their best to make things difficult for her. Woody's latest managerial decision does not go down too well with the residents, Denise hides her financial troubles from her friends and family, and Jack tries to get back to normal. Konrad continues to flirt with Shirley.(n)

programme.title: Saving Mr Banks
programme.desc: Walt Disney becomes determined to adapt Mary Poppins into a film, but faces an obstacle in the shape of author PL Travers, who resists the idea of a sentimental Hollywood version of her book. As the movie mogul's charm offensive comes unstuck, he begins to realise why the story is so important to its creator. Fact-based drama, with Emma Thompson, Tom Hanks, Paul Giamatti and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Agnes invites one last selection of celebrities into her home, as her Saturday night chat show concludes. This time, actor, singer and West End star Michael Ball pulls up a chair in Mrs Brown's sitting room, along with actress and one-time Strictly Come Dancing contestant Sunetra Sarker, most recently been seen in guest roles in both Death in Paradise and Broadchurch. Most Haunted presenter Yvette Fielding lends her ghost-hunting skills to Dermot and Buster during their Celebrity Haunted House tour, and the Vamps perform in session at Foleys. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter K, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don journeys to northern Europe, where an abundance of botanical hot spots reveals a culture obsessed with creating gardens. He discovers the floral splendour of Britain's Sissinghurst Castle and the much painted garden of impressionist Monet at Giverny, before witnessing the midnight sun in Norway as he discovers how plants behave 200 miles above the Arctic Circle.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Jim McColl plants a selection of swedes and neeps for later in the year, and Chris Beardshaw takes over an area of Beechgrove to create a rose garden, using every variety that he can - but they will all have to be able to cope with exposed Scottish conditions. Carole Baxter is in the Inverness village of Ardersier for a new strand in which she shows how to create a vegetable garden on a budget.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team explores County Durham, where Matt Baker demonstrates how to make a traditional regional dish and Ellie Harrison takes a trip up the River Tees. Sean Fletcher meets a boy scout pack involved in wildlife projects, Tom Heap reports on fly tipping, and Adam Henson meets beef farmers who feed their cows on grass alone.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: Nigel visits three home cooks to learn about well-loved variations on custard, including a fragrant Iraqi dish that takes Linda back to happy days in Baghdad. His tour of the flavours of modern Britain reveals the secrets behind home-baked Portuguese custard tarts and a delicious Malaysian custard that is not yellow, but green. Finally, Nigel comes up with some extravagant profiteroles that combine a touch of all these styles.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson examines how different days require certain types of food, sharing her favourite menu to help get that balance right in the kitchen. She prepares a light salad of salmon, avocado, watercress and pumpkin seeds, and a chicken shawarma with an array of spices, sauces and flatbreads - a dish inspired by a spit-roasted Lebanese kebab that is perfect for feeding a crowd. Nigella also creates two sweet treats, a glossy liquorice and blackcurrant chocolate cake, and chocolate chip cookie dough pots served with ice-cream or creme fraiche.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with a line-up of guests, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Nick Hope presents action from the two-day event at the Thomas Robinson Stadium in Nassau, Bahamas, which featured men's and women's 4 x 100m, 4 x 200m, 4 x 400m, 4 x 800m and distance medley races.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Final: Session One.
programme.desc: Mark Selby v John Higgins. Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the opening session of the final at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where the first eight frames of the match are scheduled to take place. Mark Selby started last year's final in fine form, winning the first six frames against Ding Junhui, before the underdog playing in his first world final managed to claw back two frames to end the session four adrift.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at Fogo Island Inn, which is sited on a rocky outpost off the northeast coast of the island of Newfoundland in Canada and pays homage to the settlers who arrived from Ireland and Devon to fish for cod - with most islanders still having Irish or West Country accents. Housekeepers Cynthia and Lori rope Giles into a community boat race, while Monica spends time with local guide Norm, who reveals surprising the secrets behind growing the perfect potato for use in the hotel.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Final: Session Two.
programme.desc: Mark Selby v John Higgins. Hazel Irvine presents all the action from the second session of the final at Sheffield's Crucible Theatre, where a further nine frames are scheduled to take place. The second session of last year's final saw Ding Junhui stage a fightback to trail Mark Selby by just one frame at 7-8, before the Jester from Leicester recovered to end the day with a 10-7 lead. The commentary team features five former world champions in Dennis Taylor, Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty and Stephen Hendry, along with Willie Thorne and John Virgo.(n)

programme.title: Drive
programme.desc: A stuntman who moonlights as a getaway driver tries to protect the wife and child of an imprisoned criminal. When the convict is released, the driver tries to convince him to give up his life of crime for his family's sake, but when they work together on a robbery, they end up drawn into a conflict with the Mafia. Crime drama, with Ryan Gosling, Carey Mulligan and Bryan Cranston.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Oxford, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience. The panel comprises Conservative Work and Pensions Secretary Damian Green, Labour MP Clive Lewis, former Liberal Democrat minister Jo Swinson, the SNP's Europe spokesperson Stephen Gethins, and journalist and member of the House of Lords, Camilla Cavendish.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: After uncovering a revelation from Matteo's past, he and Jac clash over a patient. Meanwhile, Sacha is not himself, but how long will he be able to keep Essie off the scent? Elsewhere, Ric cracks the whip on the Acute Assessment Unit floor, but a surprise visitor soon throws him off his game.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.sub-title: Tools of the Trade - Part Two.
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the show's experts offer more advice on making money from antiques and collectibles, with this edition focusing on antique domestic tools - including the most expensive ear cleaner that James Lewis has ever encountered.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and siblings David and Harry Rich compete to design a £3,000 beach-themed garden for a family of three generations. Narrated by Lucinda Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Two antiques experts put their own cash on the line as they compete to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce returns for a second episode from Pembroke Castle in West Wales. Items brought in to be valued include a sapphire ring that changes colour in different light, a papal hat that once belonged to Pope Pius XII, and a collection of Anglo-Indian paintings from 1780 that were once used to decorate a village's scout hut.(n)

programme.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
programme.desc: Villagers try to save their railway branch from closure by taking it over as a public business - but the owners of the local bus company try to sabotage their plans, forcing them to resort to more underhand methods. Ealing comedy, starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph, John Gregson, Godfrey Tearle and Sid James.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A profile of actor David Niven. The documentary highlights the film and television appearances he made over the years and captures the milestones of his fame, including his role as Phileas Fogg in Michael Todd's production of Around the World in 80 Days. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Victorian gentleman Phileas Fogg wagers he and his loyal valet Passepartout can circumnavigate the globe in only 80 days. Oscar-winning period adventure, based on Jules Verne's novel, starring David Niven, Cantinflas and Shirley MacLaine, with cameo appearances by stars including Noel Coward, Marlene Dietrich, Frank Sinatra, Buster Keaton and John Gielgud.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Final: Session Three.
programme.desc: Mark Selby v John Higgins. Hazel Irvine presents coverage from the third session of the final, as the players face a potential eight frames in the ranking tournament at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield. Ding Junhui trailed 7-10 overnight in last year's final as he tried to win the tournament for the first time in his career, but, despite closing the gap on Mark Selby to 10-11, he still ended the session with a three-frame deficit to make up.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc drives an eight-wheeled rescue vehicle from Russia, Rory Reid turns the world's ugliest car into a luxury yacht, and Chris Harris reviews the new Porsche Cayman. Plus, Jamiroquai frontman Jay Kay is the studio guest.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Final: Session Four.
programme.desc: Mark Selby v John Higgins. Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the concluding session of this year's final at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where the successful player needs to reach 18 frames to lift the famous trophy. Ding Junhui compiled the only century break in this session of last year's final, but that would have been scant consolation to the Chinese star, as he was unable to reel in Mark Selby's lead, as the world number one edged to his second world title, eventually winning 18-14 to cement his place at the top of the rankings in style. The commentary team features Dennis Taylor, Willie Thorne, Steve Davis, Ken Doherty, John Virgo, John Parrott and Stephen Hendry.(n)

programme.title: Margin Call
programme.desc: A bitter executive is dismissed from an investment bank, but plans his revenge by handing secret information on the company's fortunes to a junior analyst. When the information is decoded, it reveals that the company is on the brink of a devastating financial crisis, a revelation that is soon spreading throughout the workforce. Drama, starring Kevin Spacey, Paul Bettany and Jeremy Irons.(n)

programme.title: The Birth of British Music
programme.desc: Conductor Charles Hazlewood explores the origins of British music through the lives of four of its most notable composers. He begins by explaining how Henry Purcell captured the essence of 17th-century London in his compositions, from tavern songs and sacred music to pioneering stage works such as Dido and Aeneas. Featuring performances by the Army of Generals, John Tomlinson and the Choir of Westminster Abbey.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Motorway
programme.desc: Examining Britain's motorways through the eyes of the people who built them, those who use the roads and protesters who tried to block their construction. The first programme considers the history of the UK's first stretch of motorway, the M6 Preston Bypass.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Dancing in the Dark - The End of Physics?.
programme.desc: Scientists don't know what most of the universe is made of, with atoms accounting for only four per cent of it and the hypothetical dark matter and energy making up the rest. In the wake of an upgrade to the capabilities of Cern's Large Hadron Collider, scientists hoped to identify the nature of dark matter and reveal its secrets. The stakes are high because if the mystery is not solved, it might mean that physics itself needs a rethink.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman reports on Donald Trump's presidency so far, travelling across America as he attempts to make sense of his agenda - asking if it even makes sense to the man himself. The broadcaster digs into the stories behind the most controversial policies, visiting the home of North America's largest mosque to hear Arab-American experiences of the travel ban, and considers Trump's claims to be restoring America's economic fortunes amid the derelict factories of Detroit.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary about the superstar motorcycle stuntman, from his early career to his attempt to be fired across Snake River Canyon, revealing the man behind the charismatic performer.(n)

programme.title: The BBC at War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jonathan Dimbleby presents a documentary examining the role of the BBC during the Second World War, examining the fledgling corporation's vital role in boosting morale at home and struggles to avoid a complete government takeover. The events of the war years would come to define the BBC as an international broadcaster, transmitting in 47 languages.(n)

programme.title: Metamorphosis - The Science of Change
programme.desc: David Malone explores the processes involved in metamorphosis, the means through which one being transforms into another, and investigates why this distinctive change seems to have such a powerful grasp on the human imagination. Along the way, he highlights examples throughout the scope of historical fiction, from the epics of Ovid to the surreal short stories of Franz Kafka and the fantasy heroics of Marvel's X-Men.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Dancing in the Dark - The End of Physics?.
programme.desc: Scientists don't know what most of the universe is made of, with atoms accounting for only four per cent of it and the hypothetical dark matter and energy making up the rest. In the wake of an upgrade to the capabilities of Cern's Large Hadron Collider, scientists hoped to identify the nature of dark matter and reveal its secrets. The stakes are high because if the mystery is not solved, it might mean that physics itself needs a rethink.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Orangutan Diary
programme.desc: Michaela Strachan deals with a crisis at the rescue centre as a newly arrived baby fights for its life, but there is good news as her favourite orphan Lomon starts to make progress. Steve Leonard lends a hand at the forest school, where young apes learn skills to equip them for life in the wild, but gets a surprise when an orang-utan starts to give birth at the back of the centre.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: Penny Blacks & Twopenny Blues - How Britain Got Stuck on Stamps.
programme.desc: Andrew Martin charts the evolution of British postage stamps and looks at how they became a national obsession, examining iconic examples and famous collectors, as well as meeting modern-day philatelists at a club.(n)

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc: New series. Historian Janina Ramirez and art critic Alastair Sooke embark on cultural city breaks, offering insights into the most famous locations and uncovering hidden gems and untold stories to reveal how religion, revolution and trailblazing individuals can shape the art - and soul - of a metropolis. They begin by examining the art and design of the Dutch capital Amsterdam, along the way discovering how its culture reflects the liberal attitudes, appetite for global trade and love of home comforts that helped shape the character of this city.(n)

programme.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
programme.desc: A girl takes up the job of maid in the household of the artist Vermeer - but her presence provokes friction in the family and the jealousy of his wife when the servant catches the painter's eye. Peter Webber's 17th-century period drama adapted from the best-selling novel by Tracy Chevalier, starring Scarlett Johansson, Colin Firth, Tom Wilkinson, Judy Parfitt and Cillian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Harlots, Housewives & Heroines: A 17th Century History for Girls
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley examines the lives of women in Restoration England, discovering how some were able to thrive as British society started to move into the modern age - even if the attitudes that prevailed remained largely medieval and misogynistic. She begins by profiling Charles II's mistresses, including actress Nell Gwynn, royalist Barbara Villiers and French spy Louise de Keroualle, and explores the extent to which they were in control of their own destinies.(n)

programme.title: Aviva Premiership Rugby Highlights
programme.desc: Craig Doyle presents extended highlights of Friday's and Saturday's matches, including Harlequins v Wasps, Saracens v Bristol and Leicester Tigers v Sale Sharks.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Europa League Magazine
programme.desc: A look ahead to the UEFA Europa League semi-finals, including club features on all four of the teams involved as Ajax prepare to host Lyon and Man United travel to face Celta Vigo.(n)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Crystal Palace have been in magnificent form in the Premier League, winning six of their last nine. Will they pile more pressure on relegation-threatened Burnley at Selhurst Park?.(n)

programme.title: Premier League Tonight
programme.desc: Jake Humphrey is joined by Ian Wright, Martin Keown and Owen Hargreaves to discuss today's action, including Southampton v Hull and West Brom v Leicester.(n)

programme.title: Premier League Today
programme.desc: Jake Humphrey is joined by Dean Saunders and Michael Owen at Old Trafford to round-up all the goals from yesterday's matches and look ahead to Manchester United v Swansea.(n)

programme.title: Live Premier League
programme.sub-title: Live Manchester Utd v Swansea City.
programme.desc: With Manchester United pushing for a Champions League place and Swansea City fighting for Premier League survival, this has all the makings of a dramatic showdown at Old Trafford.(n)

programme.title: Live Premiership Rugby Union
programme.desc: West Country rivals Bath and Gloucester go toe-to-toe in the Aviva Premiership at the Rec. This is a must-win derby for the hosts, who looking to break into the top four.(n)

programme.title: BT Sport Reload
programme.desc: The best bits from BT Sport over the last week, including the pick of the goals from across Europe. Plus, action from the MotoGP in Texas, NBA, MLB, UFC and European rugby.(n)

programme.title: Live NBA Countdown
programme.desc: All the build-up to the live NBA coverage.(n)

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: Action from the NBA playoffs, a best-of-seven elimination tournament among the season's 16 best teams. The two winners (one from each conference) will go on to contest the finals.(n)

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: Action from the NBA playoffs, a best-of-seven elimination tournament among the season's 16 best teams. The two winners (one from each conference) will go on to contest the finals.(n)

programme.title: NBA Action
programme.desc: Action is the watchword for this fast paced highlights programme, which rounds up the latest action from the NBA.(n)

programme.desc: An attack on a private plane immediately after it lands turns out to be the hijack of the secret army transfer of terrorist leader Ala A Din Keshwar, the man whose release was demanded in exchange for Dom's life. programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Keelson is found to have had a huge file labelled `Callen, G', but it is destroyed remotely before Callen can retrieve it. programme.desc: The officers race against time to track down a highly specialised hit squad that has murdered an agent on assignment in Cyprus, desperate to intervene before a second target is killed. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents coverage of the fourth round of the season from Sochi Autodrom (Start-time 1.00pm), where Nico Rosberg was victorious last year. With the German having retired from the sport at the end of last season after securing the Drivers' Championship, this year's title already looks set to be a two-horse race between Rosberg's former teammate Lewis Hamilton and Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel, with the latter having triumphed last time out in Bahrain.(n)

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1 Russian Grand Prix Live Reaction: 2017.
programme.desc: Reaction to the fourth round of the season, which took place at Sochi Autodrom, and was the fourth staging of the event since it returned to the F1 calendar in 2014.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George visits a Grade-II listed worker's cottage in Hampshire, as his mission to future-proof historic houses continues. Due to restrictions on planning permissions, the property has become somewhat disorganised, and is in need of a careful makeover. Seeking inspiration, George tours a Victorian stable that was renovated to add a gym, cinema and roof garden, and heads to a farmhouse in East Sussex to view a smart and stylish solution to the problem of designing new, accessible bathrooms for period properties.(n)

programme.title: Escape to Costa Rica
programme.desc: Science writer Gaia Vince explores the island, which is the most sustainable nation in the world, home to over 500,000 species of animal and with a national grid run on rivers and volcanoes that is due to be completely carbon neutral by 2021. She meets the republic's president, who explains his environmental policies, and joins a team of scientists helping to preserve the island's forests and wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: Mud
programme.desc: Two boys exploring an island on the Mississippi discover a fugitive has made his home there. He tells them he is on the run from bounty hunters after killing a man, and needs their help to be reunited with his lost love. As they ferry messages to the woman in question, the youngsters are forced to come to terms with the complexity of adult relationships. Drama, starring Matthew McConaughey and Reese Witherspoon.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Property duo Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp take their house-hunting expertise to the West Midlands and Shropshire. Kirstie meets Hannah and John Sherlock, who want to downsize and move into Shrewsbury town centre on a budget of £350,000, while in Wolverhampton, Phil is with professional musicians Me'sha and Darren, who are looking to buy their first home together, close to Me'sha's family.(n)

Later, he takes the guests to a salsa class, where Sherrill Tacy and Hayley Cotton are surprised by some of his dance moves.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray enlists his mother's help to reassure Ally, who is afraid to sleep in her own room because she is convinced it becomes the haunt of monsters once the lights go out. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie is thrilled to learn that Robert's new girlfriend is a virgin, so Ray tries to convince her that Debra is a `good girl' too, leading to a surprising revelation from Marie and Frank.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pair's friendship. However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg.(n)

programme.desc: A stray cat wanders into a magician's mansion, and finds it is full of strange gadgets. The illusionist allows him to stay, to the annoyance of his other pets, but the cat proves an invaluable addition to the group when their owner's scheming nephew plots to take the house for himself. Animated adventure, with the voices of Murray Blue and Doug Stone.(n)

programme.desc: A New York teenager moves with her parents to a small town, where she quickly gets drawn into a bitter conflict with a local girl - until auditions for a musical give her the chance to outshine her rival. Meanwhile, she faces the challenge of working out how to get back to the big city for her favourite band's farewell concert. Drama, starring Lindsay Lohan, Adam Garcia, Glenne Headly and Alison Pill.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

Over a packed mini-break, they sample the city's finest sausages, cakes, wines and spirits and visit fairgrounds, cafes and sewers, while Richard suffers an allergic reaction and Chris breaks something valuable.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Hoarders
programme.desc: Experts in the field of hoarding disorder spend over three months carefully treating two people who have a persistent difficulty in discarding or parting with possessions - hoping to transform their lives and mend their failing relationships. Sue in Nottinghamshire has hundreds of dolls all around her house, driving her partner Neil to despair, while Scott stores thousands of spare computer and hardware parts piled high in every room of the house he shares with wife Faith, including the bedroom and bathroom.(n)

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls
programme.desc: With old and young now living side by side, the islanders are hoping to hit their stride, but the lack of food is an ever-pressing concern and tempers are fraying. Jordan is feeling out of sorts and then has a fight with Richie, while the members of the group are furious when Phil uses some olive oil to boost the fire rather than for food. Soon there is another bust up, stretching relations between the participants to breaking point. Could a shocking vote see the islanders turn on one of their own?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.desc: Spoilt child Timmy goes to live with his outwardly respectable father, but realises he is a small-time thief planning his latest robbery. Family comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Ted Danson, Glenne Headly and Hector Elizondo.(n)

programme.title: Three Men and a Little Lady
programme.desc: Bachelor Jack and his two best buddies have brought up his baby Mary since she was left in their care by her mother, Sylvia. Now that Mary is five years old, Sylvia believes she needs a more conventional upbringing and decides to accept a marriage proposal from an English aristocrat, leaving the trio of dads rushing to stop the wedding. Comedy sequel, with Tom Selleck, Ted Danson and Steve Guttenberg. Edited for language.(n)

programme.title: Housesitter
programme.desc: An architect has a fling with a kooky waitress, who takes it upon herself to move into his house and pass herself off as his wife. When the woman he is actually in love with says she thinks the sham marriage is good for him, he decides to play along with the deception. Romantic comedy, starring Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn, Dana Delany, Donald Moffat and Julie Harris. Edited for language and sexual content.(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: An English nobleman returns home from the crusades to find his father has been murdered and the local people are repressed by the tyrannical rule of the Sheriff of Nottingham. Branded an outlaw, he recruits a group of bandits to fight for justice and protect the downtrodden. Action adventure, starring Kevin Costner, Alan Rickman, Morgan Freeman and Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio. Edited for violence and language. Includes a 5 News Update at 9.45pm.(n)

programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Greatest Ever 90s Movies
programme.desc: Patsy Kensit presents a countdown of some of the most memorable films from the last decade of the 20th century, including Titanic, Trainspotting, Goodfellas and The Shawshank Redemption. Ranked according to their success at the box-office, Patsy reveals which films released between 1990 and 1999 managed to capture the public imagination on their initial cinematic debuts.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: Goal Rush
programme.desc: Action from the final fixtures of the regular season in League One, including Southend United v Bury, Bristol Rovers v Millwall and Gillingham v Fleetwood Town.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and also features footage of reckless and dangerous drivers.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Charade
programme.desc: A distraught widow learns her husband was murdered for his part in a $250,000 robbery. The haul has gone missing, and his former accomplices are soon on her tail in the hunt for the missing proceeds. Not knowing where to turn, she takes up the offer of help from a dashing stranger, but is uncertain whether she can trust him. Romantic thriller, with Audrey Hepburn, Cary Grant, Walter Matthau and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice meets homeowners near Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, who are having trouble selling up. She shows them how to inject a touch of vitality and character into their bland property.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.desc: Hellie makes an emergency landing and has trouble getting airborne again.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: The youngster briefly glimpses a big blue rock in the sky, but Salty thinks she has been imagining things, so the pair set out to find it again.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: The plant disappears underground, so Mofy and Mogu decide to find out what is going on.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa help Mummy Pig tidy up, and learn about recycling.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster discovers that everyone else has a kind of collection and decides she needs one too.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Mayor Goodway calls on the Paw Patrol to rescue her twin niece and nephew from a tree and then look after them for the day.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and his team are fitting a lift into a Spring City skyscraper, Scoop decides that he would like to see the view from the top.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The annual Pontypandy Cheese Roll Challenge takes place, but Norman Price diverts the path of the cheese to the edge of a cliff and finds himself in big trouble.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Everyone wants to know about new engine Geoffrey, who Thomas invented to take the blame for an accident.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive monkey meets a beekeeper and discovers why the insects are so busy.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: The twin genies-in-training discover a magical gem that makes two of everything - including Zeta.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Popping Balloons.
programme.desc: Noddy and his friends are each given a colourful balloon at the end of Smartysaurus's party, but when a number of balloons start bursting, Noddy tries to find out why.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The pups plan a special celebration for Wally the Walrus, but when he doesn't show up, they find that he has a special new friend named Walinda.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The fairies wake up to find their wands are not working, forcing the kingdom to go without the help of magic for a day.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: All of his friends have won the Great Soapbox Race before, but Digby has only ever come second and this year he is determined to win - but so is Grizel.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children take a trip to a Dinosaur Park to celebrate Freddy Fox's birthday.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig reads Peppa and George a bedtime story, but it is not long before the pair are awake again.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: A mummy pig's piglets cannot cover themselves in mud because their waterhole has dried up.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: The little girl rabbit plays out in the rain with the sheep, the ducks and her best friend Alien, who uses magic to make Wanda a necklace from raindrops.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Matthew Wright is joined by a panel of guests and the studio audience to debate the issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The doctors meet a patient suffering from high blood pressure caused by stress, and set him on a course of action that should allow him to reclaim his life. Meanwhile, Dr Ward treats Ned, a man suffering from persistent pins and needles in his hands, and a young lady concerned about unwanted hair on her chin.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Phoebe seeks solace in alcohol, VJ questions his parenting ability after seeing Luc with Irene, and Olivia has reservations when Hunter suggests they move in together.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: The Lassiter's Bonza Barbie Bash leads to Amy react badly after seeing Leo with someone else and David attempt to hook up with one of the backpackers.(n)

programme.title: Clash of the Titans
programme.desc: A hero of ancient Greece vows to save a princess from being sacrificed to a ferocious sea monster. However, to defeat the creature he must first embark on a journey into the underworld and seize the head of the monstrous Medusa, whose gaze turns men to stone. Mythical adventure, starring Harry Hamlin, Laurence Olivier, Maggie Smith and Judi Bowker, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen. Edited for violence and nudity.(n)

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts
programme.desc: The son of an overthrown king must embark on an epic sea voyage in search of the fabled Golden Fleece so he can return and reclaim his kingdom. Before he can seize the treasure, he has to overcome a series of horrific creatures, including a seven-headed monster and a horde of sword-wielding skeletons. Mythological fantasy adventure, starring Todd Armstrong, Honor Blackman, Nancy Kovack, Niall MacGinnis and Patrick Troughton, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen. Includes 5 News Update at 4.20pm.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: The Lassiter's Bonza Barbie Bash leads to Amy react badly after seeing Leo with someone else and David attempt to hook up with one of the backpackers.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Phoebe seeks solace in alcohol, VJ questions his parenting ability after seeing Luc with Irene, and Olivia has reservations when Hunter suggests they move in together.(n)

programme.title: FIA World Rally Championship Highlights
programme.desc: The Rally Argentina. Highlights of the fifth round of the season, which took place in the lakeside resort of Villa Carlos Paz in the province of Cordoba. Reigning champion Sebastien Ogier came into this event at the top of the standings, and held a 13-point lead over his nearest rival Jari-Matti Latvala.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Tim and Tom team up with Merseyside police to carry out a raid on a house in Liverpool, Jim wrestles with an aggressive driver, and officers armed with Tasers respond to an alleged assault with a meat cleaver. Plus, Dicko is called upon when a young man is stabbed in a street brawl.(n)

programme.title: The Story of
programme.desc: Profile of the comedian, examining her early years performing at the Edinburgh Festival in the 1990s, inspired by her hero Eric Morecambe. Her act led to supporting roles in Smack the Pony, Absolutely Fabulous and Not Going Out, before reaching stardom with writing and starring in her successful sitcom and a dramatic role in Call the Midwife.(n)

programme.title: Most Shocking Celebrity Moments
programme.sub-title: The Most Shocking Celebrity Moments of 2016.
programme.desc: Louis Walsh, Michelle Visage, Darren Day, Bobby Norris, Chloe Khan, Eamonn Holmes, Kerry Katona, Stefan Dennis and Len Goodman recall the year's showbiz events. Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie split, while the curious coupling of Liam Payne and Cheryl occurred. Meanwhile, Justin Bieber was mean to his fans, Kanye West reignited his long-running feud with Taylor Swift, and Zayn Malik revealed the real reason for leaving One Direction. Shockingly good moments included politician Ed Balls on Strictly and Honey G on The X Factor, while the restart of Top Gear failed to fire on all cylinders.(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: Genre-busting college classic with a career-best turn from John Belushi as the brew-swilling Bluto. Toga parties, drunken romance and sadistic army cadets: the film that broke the mould for teen comedy(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: After standing in as a female model for a painting by his wife Gerda (Alicia Vikander), Danish artist Einar Wegener (Eddie Redmayne) becomes enamored with his feminine identity and begins living as a woman named Lili Elbe. Although their marriage becomes strained, Gerda stands by Lili as she explores her true self and eventually undergoes one of the world's first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. This touching biopic was adapted from David Ebershoff's book of the same name, and helmed by director Tom Hooper (The King's Speech)(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard. Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. The more Steve learns about Ayers, the more he longs to help the troubled soul(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: In this raunchy yet heartfelt comedy, a commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must reevaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: Newlywed Ted wants to become a father, but must prove he's a person in a court of law first(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: Maze Runner: Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding installment in the dystopian young-adult series, Thomas and the other Gladers journey across an obstacle-filled wasteland called the Scorch. Along the way, they search for information regarding the organization known as WCKD(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Humans and orcs clash in this film adaptation of the popular video-game series(n)

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: Dominic Toretto and his tight-knit gang of street racers must battle the brother of a defeated nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists. The film is dedicated to series regular Paul Walker, who died halfway through production(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Night Watch director Timur Bekmambetov helms his first English-language feature film with this big-screen adaptation of Mark Millar's action-packed graphic novel. Wesley Gibson (James McAvoy) is a cube-dwelling hypochondriac whose uneventful life has become a mundane blur of terminal boredom. Repeatedly humiliated by his boss and constantly cuckolded by his cheating girlfriend, weakling Wes seems to be living right down to everyone's expectations that he would never amount to anything in life. However, upon discovering that the father he never knew has been brutally murdered, the spineless, clock-punching pushover is recruited into a secret society of assassins known as the Fraternity. During the course of his training, the man who was once an office-bound wimp develops lightning-fast reflexes and superhuman dexterity courtesy of his skilled mentor Fox (Angelina Jolie). Upon completing his training, Wes is assigned the task of dealing out death to the mythological Fates, who possess the ability to alter the lifelines of mortal men. It isn't long before the nebbish nerd-turned-agile assassin is erasing the bad guys with surprising efficiency, yet as Wes begins to carry the mantle passed down to him by his father, he gradually begins to suspect that his wise tutors are not the crime-fighting enforcers they present themselves to be. Now, with everything he ever wanted in life finally within his grasp, Wes is about to find out that the only thing more difficult than ending the lives of others is summoning the courage to take control of his own(n)

programme.title: Frank Miller's Sin City
programme.desc: In this collection of crime tales set in the underbelly of a miserable metropolis, a bruiser seeks the person who killed his one-night stand. Elsewhere, a cop is framed for a series of murders, and a group of prostitutes must dispose of a dead body(n)

programme.title: Felices 140
programme.desc: A woman reveals to her nearest and dearest she has won the lottery at her lavish 40th birthday party. But, instead of celebrating with her, the guests begin to plot against her(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three romantically deprived women all find satisfaction in affairs with the same mysterious, charming stranger but slowly come to realize that this man may in fact be Satan himself. This popular fantasy drama features an all-star cast and a script based upon the best-selling novel by John Updike(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: Armed and dangerous action with Arnold Schwarzenegger as the US Marshal assigned to protect a vital government witness from high-powered criminals(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: Romantic action adventure based on the legendary nobleman-turned-outlaw. On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Biopic of Ernie Davis, who overcame prejudice to become the first black athlete to win the highest honour in college football(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: An NYPD detective's probe into the murder of four cops points to corruption and his own brother and brother-in-law---both of whom are cops. Edward Norton, Colin Farrell and Jon Voight star in this gritty and well-acted tale of duty, honor and loyalty. Noah Emmerich, Jennifer Ehle. Directed by Gavin O'Connor(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: George Clooney is the psychologist sent to investigate strange events on a space station orbiting the planet Prometheus. The planet seems to be able to take over astronauts' minds and the shrink is shocked to encounter his late wife(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer and her writer husband take a cross-country journey to a small coastal town where they bond with its quirky but wise inhabitants(n)

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: Comedy in which a millionaire and his spoilt and arrogant wife charter a yacht to take them and a group of friends from Greece to Italy. When she is unimpressed with her journey, the millionaire's wife takes her anger out on the crew, but the tables are turned when she is stranded on a desert island with one of the sailors(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A loner protecting a baby from hit men(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. Remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster(n)

programme.title: Employee of the Month
programme.desc: (2006) Greg Coolidge's comedy is set in a department store and stars Dane Cook as Zack, who works in the packing department, and Dax Shepard as Vince, one of the cashiers. Zack's ambition in life is to perfect the art of slacking while Vince is the store's biggest suck-up. But then they both hear that hot new cashier Amy (Jessica Simpson) has one firm rule: she will only date the Employee of the Month. Can Zack manage to beat Vince to the title?(n)

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Dead Woman Walking: The Karla Faye Tucker Story
programme.desc: Dead Woman Walking: The Karla Faye Tucker Story. This documentary, part of the American Justice series from A&E, examines the Texas death penalty case of Karla Faye Walker. Narrated by American Justice host and producer Bill Kurtis, this episode goes inside the investigation of the two murders that Walker and her boyfriend Daniel Ryan Garrett committed. The trial of Walker is shown through exclusive footage. After the conviction, American Justice follows her through her daily life, showing her prison surroundings and talking with her about her crimes. Sentenced to death, while Walker was waiting to be executed, she became a born-again Christian. Her lawyers used this transformation as leverage to try to get her death sentence reduced to life in prison. Their attempts were unsuccessful and Walker was killed by lethal injection in February 1998. American Justice also shows interviews with lawyers and law enforcement professionals who knew Walker(n)

programme.title: The Best of Top Gear
programme.desc: Highlights of the greatest challenges the team had to overcome, featuring Jeremy Clarkson taking on a tank in a Range Rover Sport, James May race a BMX around London, and Richard Hammond trying to outsprint a greyhound with the Mazda MX5. programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles, and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover.(n)

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The work of Yorkshire's Regional Roads Crime Team, who are using headcams as a new tool to collect evidence. A drugs dealer is faced with a police search on camera and a first-time offender speeds away from the cops in his wife's car, so the officers take off in pursuit. A drunk-driver is rudely woken by the police in a hotel car park, leading to an unexpected find.(n)

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Following a successful pilot scheme trailing the use of body cameras, Staffordshire Police officers are now wearing them on patrol to increase transparency and bring offenders to justice. The series provides a hard-hitting mixture of bodycam and observational footage, reflecting the daily challenges of combating crime and revealing fresh insights into the fast-paced world of modern policing.(n)

programme.title: Arnie's Greatest Ever Stunts
programme.desc: Actor and former Governor of California Arnold Schwarzenegger presents a countdown of the most spectacular stunts ever committed to film. The Terminator star famously insisted on performing many of his own stunts during his Hollywood action-man heyday, and here, he highlights the achievements of fellow stars whose efforts produced thrilling set-pieces on-screen. However, Arnie does not limit himself to high-octane antics from the silver screen. He also showcases stand-alone feats, such as Jean Claude Van Damme's daring splits manoeuvre between two moving trucks, and Felix Baumgartner's free fall to Earth from the stratosphere. Includes commentary from fans, comedians, stunt coordinators and the daredevils themselves.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review.(n)

What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.(n)

programme.desc: Adaptation of DH Lawrence's classic novel about an aristocratic woman enjoying a happy marriage to her husband, until he is severely wounded while fighting in the First World War. Confined to a wheelchair, Sir Clifford Chatterley becomes more distant from Lady Constance, who embarks on a passionate affair with the estate's gamekeeper Mellors. Knowing their affair would scandalise society and ostracise them both, they strive to evade the growing suspicions of her jealous and vengeful husband. programme.title: Death Comes to Pemberley
programme.desc: Anna Maxwell Martin, Matthew Rhys and Jenna Coleman star in this sequel to Pride and Prejudice, adapted from the best-selling novel by PD James, which brings Jane Austen's world back to life in a highly original way - with a murder mystery plot at its centre. The drama picks up six years on from the marriage of Elizabeth and Darcy, as the couple prepare for the lavish annual ball at their magnificent Pemberley home. However, the unannounced arrival of Elizabeth's wayward sister Lydia brings the event to an abrupt halt when she stumbles in screaming that her husband, Wickham, has been murdered. Darcy leads a search party out to the woodlands and finds a blood-soaked corpse - but it's not the body they were expecting to find. Trevor Eve, Rebecca Front, James Fleet and Matthew Goode co-star.(n)

programme.title: Death Comes to Pemberley
programme.desc: Wickham's arrest leads to the cancellation of the ball, and Jane arrives to help quell Lydia and Mrs Bennet's hysterics. Darcy gradually begins to retreat into a version of his younger self, a change that threatens his marriage, and Elizabeth grows concerned after her husband declares that his sister Georgiana must marry for duty, while there are disturbing revelations about, and by, Louisa Bidwell. Anna Maxwell Martin and Matthew Rhys star in this sequel to Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice, adapted from the best-selling novel by PD James.(n)

programme.title: Death Comes to Pemberley
programme.desc: Elizabeth remains aggrieved at Darcy's treatment of Georgiana, but her immediate concern is for her sister Lydia, whose husband's indiscretions and secrets look likely to come to light during his trial for the murder of Captain Denny. As the court case progresses, Darcy realises his preoccupation with Pemberley has served to distance himself from both his wife and his sister, and he reaches out to the pair of them. The trial draws to a close, and Wickham's fate remains in the balance - until a last-minute turn of events promises to save him from the hangman's noose. Anna Maxwell Martin and Matthew Rhys star in this sequel to Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice, adapted from the best-selling novel by PD James.(n)

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie, Samantha, Charlotte and Miranda return in this comedy drama set four years after the finale of the hugely successful TV series. All the key characters are present and (mostly) correct in the first big-screen version of the franchise, directed by Michael Patrick King (who also directed 10 of the TV episodes). Unsurprisingly, things have moved on for Carrie, Samantha, Charlotte and Miranda. Samantha is living in LA to be close to her now-famous actor lover Smith, but she's far from happy. Miranda is juggling the competing demands on her day-to-day life, and her world is rocked when Steve makes a surprise confession. And, while out looking for a new apartment, Big pops the question to a surprised Carrie. But, this being Sex and the City, there are plenty of plot twists for each of the characters (as well as laughs and the occasional tear for the viewers) before the credits roll..(n)

programme.title: Maid in Manhattan
programme.desc: Jennifer Lopez and Ralph Fiennes star in this romcom, director Wayne Wang's modern-day take on the Cinderella folk tale. Single parent Marisa Ventura works in an upmarket New York hotel where a swanky event is taking place. When she's instructed by one of the moneyed guests to return an expensive freebie dress, Marisa can't help but try the unwanted garment on. And that's when she bumps into rising politico Christopher Marshall, who is clearly smitten. From the context of their meeting, he naturally assumes that she's a socialite - will he still feel the same attraction for her if he discovers that she is, in fact, a maid?(n)

programme.title: Penguins - Spy in the Huddle
programme.desc: David Tennant narrates an insight into this most intriguing and comical of birds, beginning with three different species' journeys to reach their breeding grounds. Emperor penguins cross a treacherous frozen sea, and rockhoppers brave stormy seas before they come ashore and face a daunting assault up a 300ft cliff, where they are vulnerable to predators. Meanwhile, the tropical humboldts have to evade sea lions, dodge vampire bats and battle sea birds before they can lay their eggs in the desert. All the while, their every move is being secretly filmed by hidden spy technology, including robotic penguins with cameras for eyes.(n)

programme.title: Penguins - Spy in the Huddle
programme.desc: The second part of the documentary sees the chicks hatching in Antarctica, the Falklands and Peru, leading to delightful scenes as the new parents help their young take their first few unsteady steps. All three colonies share one thing in common, however - there are plenty of predators eager to get hold of the new arrivals, giving the parents a tough job to protect their babies.(n)

programme.title: Penguins - Spy in the Huddle
programme.desc: The emperor penguins are swamped by hungry imposters as they try to feed their chicks, the humboldts are left in their burrows as the adults head for a beach swarming with cormorants, and the rockhopper youngsters practise their jumping skills. Eventually, having grown up and become independent, all the penguins leave for the sea, tackling the same hazards as their parents before them. David Tennant narrates. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife Special
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the numerous species of bear. Specialist cameras are used to blend into the environment, allowing for previously unseen glimpses of giant panda, grizzly and polar bears, along with their South American cousins, spectacled bear and black bear.(n)

programme.title: Trek: Spy on the Wildebeest
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary about Africa's great wildebeest migration, during which more than one million animals make the arduous 3,000km round trip across Tanzania's Serengeti and Kenya's Masai Mara. Remote spycams follow a calf as it tries to evade lions, cheetahs, hyenas and crocodiles, and faces some of nature's most gruelling physical challenges during the year-long journey.(n)

programme.title: Trek: Spy on the Wildebeest
programme.desc: Conclusion. The migration reaches Kenya's Masai Mara, where the river presents the strongest challenge yet for the calves. Cameras reveal how crocodiles and hippos are preying on stragglers, while the rough waters threaten to sweep the animals away.(n)

programme.title: Outback Rangers
programme.desc: The team attempts to track down a rogue saltwater crocodile. Documentary following the armed rangers of Kakadu National Park in the Northern Territory, Australia.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: A team of marine experts reveal the hidden stories of our planet's last true wilderness - its oceans. Here, they investigate how the predatory Humboldt squid is invading the sea.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The team go in search of the weedy sea dragon and investigate why parts of the Southern Ocean are warming much faster than other oceans.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: An insight into the largely unexplored Southern Red Sea, which is teeming with marine life and home to some of the warmest waters on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose, environmentalist Philippe Cousteau Jr, maritime archaeologist Dr Lucy Blue and marine biologist Tooni Mahto base themselves in the Bahamas to explore the Atlantic. On the island of Andros, they go on a risky dive to discover what the oceans looked like 3.5 billion years ago, and investigate an underwater cave system thought to hold the remains of the first inhabitants.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The first of two episodes exploring the Indian Ocean, which accounts for 13 per cent of Earth's surface and covers 26 million square miles. The expedition visits a `coral nursery', one of the few places in the world where an extraordinary technique is being used to repair damaged reefs. Paul Rose and the team also head to a small community in Mozambique where shark fishing is an established practice.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: In the second of two episodes examining the Indian Ocean, Paul Rose, Philippe Cousteau Jr, Dr Lucy Blue and Tooni Mahto explore the impact the ocean's tides and currents have on coastal areas. They join a group of scientists working on an experiment to predict extreme weather, and dive down to a coral colony - an environment in which they can learn about changes in the planet's climate.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The crew embarks on a journey through the Mediterranean Sea, whose coasts are among the most densely populated in the world, to explore the profound effect man has had on the body of water. Paul Rose and the team also visit the remains of a Roman shipwreck and, under the cover of night, dive the Straits of Messina, hoping to find and film the sixgill shark - one of the largest predatory sharks in the world.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The team explores the Arctic Ocean, one of the most hostile environments on Earth, yet one that plays a crucial part in controlling the climate of the planet. Paul Rose and the crew dive beneath the polar ice cap to examine how the ice, the dominant feature of the ocean, is shrinking and how this could affect the rest of the world. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: A team of marine experts reveal the hidden stories of our planet's last true wilderness - its oceans. Here, they investigate how the predatory Humboldt squid is invading the sea.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The team go in search of the weedy sea dragon and investigate why parts of the Southern Ocean are warming much faster than other oceans.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: An insight into the largely unexplored Southern Red Sea, which is teeming with marine life and home to some of the warmest waters on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose, environmentalist Philippe Cousteau Jr, maritime archaeologist Dr Lucy Blue and marine biologist Tooni Mahto base themselves in the Bahamas to explore the Atlantic. On the island of Andros, they go on a risky dive to discover what the oceans looked like 3.5 billion years ago, and investigate an underwater cave system thought to hold the remains of the first inhabitants.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The first of two episodes exploring the Indian Ocean, which accounts for 13 per cent of Earth's surface and covers 26 million square miles. The expedition visits a `coral nursery', one of the few places in the world where an extraordinary technique is being used to repair damaged reefs. Paul Rose and the team also head to a small community in Mozambique where shark fishing is an established practice.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: In the second of two episodes examining the Indian Ocean, Paul Rose, Philippe Cousteau Jr, Dr Lucy Blue and Tooni Mahto explore the impact the ocean's tides and currents have on coastal areas. They join a group of scientists working on an experiment to predict extreme weather, and dive down to a coral colony - an environment in which they can learn about changes in the planet's climate.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The crew embarks on a journey through the Mediterranean Sea, whose coasts are among the most densely populated in the world, to explore the profound effect man has had on the body of water. Paul Rose and the team also visit the remains of a Roman shipwreck and, under the cover of night, dive the Straits of Messina, hoping to find and film the sixgill shark - one of the largest predatory sharks in the world.(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Days
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in a superb political thriller set during the Cuban missile crisis in October 1962. JFK is under enormous pressure as he fights to avoid a nuclear war. Dir: Roger Donaldson(n)

programme.title: The Family Stone
programme.desc: The normally laid-back Stone family are shocked when golden child Everett brings his uptight, bigoted fiancee Meredith home to meet them for Christmas(n)

programme.title: The Towering Inferno
programme.desc: Steve McQueen and Paul Newman star in Irwin Allen's classic disaster movie as fire chief Mike O'Hallorhan and architect Doug Roberts, both trying to battle the blaze in Roberts' 135-storey skyscraper, where the guests at a prestigious party are trapped on the top floor(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Classic western remake of The Seven Samurai. A Mexican village is at the mercy of Calvera, the leader of a band of outlaws. The townspeople, too afraid to fight for themselves, hire seven American gunslingers to free them from the bandits' raids. The professional gunmen train the villagers to defend themselves, then plan a trap for the evil Calvera(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: A janitor at MIT, Will Hunting has a gift for maths that can take him light-years beyond his blue-collar roots, but to achieve his dream he must turn his back on the neighborhood and his best friend. To complicate matters, two strangers enter the equation: a washed-up shrink who starts to coach Will through his transformation, and a med student who shows him that there can be a pretty face along with his life of the mind(n)

programme.title: The Family Stone
programme.desc: The normally laid-back Stone family are shocked when golden child Everett brings his uptight, bigoted fiancee Meredith home to meet them for Christmas(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life and forced to move cities. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings(n)

programme.title: John Tucker Must Die
programme.desc: John Tucker is a high school basketball star dating three girls at the same time: the activist vegan, the over-achieving blonde journalist, and the sassy cheerleading squad captain. They all find out about each other and with the help of the shy new girl in school, Kate, they plot a devious revenge. The girls decide to combine their knowledge to make Kate into the perfect seduction machine and break Tucker's heart(n)

programme.desc: A successful Manhattan yuppie becomes the custodian for a one-year old. Though she plans to give the child up for adoption, she grows to love motherhood, leading to an unexpected career change(n)

programme.title: World Without End
programme.desc: A Crown Tested. The second part of Ken Follett's epic sequel to The Pillars of the Earth starring Cynthia Nixon, Peter Firth, Charlotte Riley and Miranda Richardson. Following the devastating effects of the bridge collapse in the medieval town of Kingsbridge, young medical student Caris takes charge of caring for the casualties as the townsfolk mourn their losses. While Godwyn argues that the disaster is a divine sign that the town should return to stricter ways, Merthin convinces Caris that all is not lost, encouraging her to carry on and rebuild the bridge with stone. However, their plan is stilted when the newly-appointed Lord of Wigleigh, Ralph, refuses Wulfric's inheritance, intent on carrying out Queen Isabella's order to stop work on the new bridge. Still determined to push for change, Godwyn is hell-bent on becoming the new Prior and securing the power that comes with it. Using his secret grant from Queen Isabella as blackmail against him, Godwyn discredits younger favourite, Thomas, making him look incompetent, and is duly appointed. Meanwhile, the Queen carries out a crafty plan to convince her son, King Edward III, to declare war on her enemies. Writer: John Pielmeier (based on the novel by Ken Follett)(n)
