programme.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
programme.desc: Alexandre Dumas's classic adventure story is stylishly adapted in this action-packed version. Edmond Dantes is a wrongly imprisoned man who plots an elaborate revenge against those who betrayed him(n)

programme.title: Stripes
programme.desc: Army farce follows a band of raw recruits through basic training and their first detail(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Sc-fi actioner about a man who doubts his identity when he starts remembering a series of repressed memories about Mars; a planet he has never seemingly visited. As he delves deeper into the mystery he begins to question his very reality and wonder which version is real(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: A life-changing journey to East Africa causes a former gang member (Gerard Butler) to dedicate his life to rescuing children who were captured and trained as soldiers by the Lord's Resistance Army in this inspirational drama based on actual events(n)

programme.title: The Way of the Gun
programme.desc: In this suspense thriller, two small-time crooks make a bid for the big time with disastrous results. Robin (Juliette Lewis) is carrying a child as a surrogate mother for a wealthy couple, Hale and Francesca Chidduck (Scott Wilson and Kristin Lehman) when she's kidnapped by Parker (Ryan Phillippe) and Longbaugh (Benicio Del Toro), who believe that the adoptive parents will pay a large ransom to ensure the safety of both mother and baby. The kidnappers soon discover that they're out of their league when they're confronted by Mafia-connected lawyer Joe Sarno (James Caan) and a pair of hired killers, Jeffers (Taye Diggs) and Obecks (Nicky Katt); at the same time, Parker finds himself increasingly attached to Robin. The Way of the Gun marked the directorial debut of screenwriter Christopher McQuarrie, whose script credits include The Usual Suspects and Public Access(n)

programme.title: Bloodsport
programme.desc: American special forces commando Frank Dux goes AWOL to compete in the Kumite, a clandestine martial arts contest held in Hong Kong. Action(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Sc-fi actioner about a man who doubts his identity when he starts remembering a series of repressed memories about Mars; a planet he has never seemingly visited. As he delves deeper into the mystery he begins to question his very reality and wonder which version is real(n)

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: Andrew Davis, whose previous credits include Under Siege and The Fugitive, brings all his experience to bear on this conspiracy-action-thriller. Keanu Reeves stars as Eddie Kasalivich, a brilliant physicist who's part of a university research team looking at alternative energy solutions. When they crack the holy grail, delivering free energy from water, they're ready to announce their find to the world. But an explosion at their laboratory destroys the work and kills the team leader and Kasalicich, together with Dr Lily Sinclair finds himself suspected of sabotage and murder. On the run, with the mysterious Paul Shannon and the even more shadowy Lyman Earl Collier co-ordinating the operation to track them down and, if necessary, 'terminate them with extreme predjudice', the pair have to not just prove their innocence but save their secret. The double and triple-dealings are balanced by the fast-moving chase sequences with Reeves, a veteran of Speed and The Matrix well used to handling the action role while Weiz's character is a feisty fighter rather than just eye candy(n)

programme.title: Valkyrie
programme.desc: At the absolute height of World War II, German generals hatch a daring plan to assassinate Adolf Hitler and effectively render the German war machine impotent. Directed by Bryan Singer, Valkyrie stars Tom Cruise as Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg, the real-life mastermind behind the elaborate plot known as Project Valkyrie: a plan to assassinate Hitler and overthrow his government from the inside. Stauffenberg has been a loyal soldier and an asset to the Reich for his entire military career, but after losing an eye, a hand, and three fingers in an Allied bombing, he reaches a breaking point. The destructive madness that his country is unleashing on the world has become too terrible for the colonel to stand silent. He joins the resistance movement -- a treasonous act, punishable by death -- and risks his life and the life of his family for the chance to change history. Comprised of high-ranking officials working in secret, the German Resistance has access to the inner workings of the government and military, putting them in the perfect position to dispatch the dictator and then use his own official contingency plan to seize power -- before the army, the S.S., and loyal party members can put someone just as diabolical in the Führer's place(n)

programme.title: Highlander: Endgame
programme.desc: Connor Macleod is sick and tired of his immortal life and retreat inside the Sanctuarty, where immortals can escape life forever. But when his old enemy, Jacob Kell attack the Sanctuary and kill everyone but Connor he is once again forces into battle. Jacob Kell is strong and Connor soon realize he will need every help he can get to win(n)

programme.title: Never Back Down
programme.desc: After moving to Florida, an Iowa teen gets mixed up in an underground fighting league and is mentored by a mixed-martial-arts master in this derivative and cliché-ridden story(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: Beneath the Surface. While attending his orphanage reunion, Face (Dirk Benedict) links up with two old flames, Rebecca Piper (Nancy Everhard) and Elaine Green (Kim Ulrich). Unfortunately, Rebecca turns out to be as two-faced as ever, betraying Face and the rest of the A-Team to Gen. Fullbright (Jack Ging). As for Elaine, she needs the Team to find her missing oceanographer brother Barry (Tom Villard), which they agree to do provided they can elude Fullbright's minions. The key to the intrigue is a phony treasure map given by Face to Barry when both were children; trouble is, the map isn't phony at all!(n)

programme.title: 88 Minutes
programme.desc: After receiving a call claiming he has only 88 minutes to live, a forensic psychiatrist and college professor races against time to stay alive and find the caller. Al Pacino stars in this involving mystery thriller filled with twists and turns. Alicia Witt, Leelee Sobieski, Amy Brenneman, William Forsythe, Deborah Kara Unger. Directed by Jon Avnet(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An enigmatic killer shoots dead a businessman spending Thanksgiving at a hotel in the city, then takes his glasses, jewellery and ID to Washington Dulles airport, which has been brought to a stand-still by a massive snowstorm. As the murderer's actions take effect, a terror alert is issued, leaving all northern US airports in a state of panic, and leaving it up to DiNozzo, Bishop and her husband - all of whom are trapped at Dulles by the weather - to bring the armed villain to justice. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherley.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee deals with his father's recent death by writing him a letter outlining the details of his latest investigation. The case involved tracking down a hactivist collective known as Krampus, who were thought to have been responsible for an incident in which the internet crashed all over Washington, DC. McGee and Abby brought in three known cyber-terrorists for questioning, and discover evidence that links the trio to an attempted breach of the Congress email server and archive. However, when this line of inquiry reaches a dead-end, the team picks up a new lead that suggests an isolated hacker from Wisconsin may be responsible. This `lone wolf' scenario does not seem plausible to McGee, though, as he recalls a lesson his late dad taught him. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The bodies of five people, all of whom are identified as being from the US Navy, are found on the floor of a diner, and all are connected to a suspicious tax firm that specialises in helping people who are in arrears. When further killings are linked to the business, the team realises the crime seem to be copycats of previous cases. Meanwhile, two of Gibbs' ex-wives appear at the location with something important to discuss with the agent. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: American social worker Sarah Goode is taken hostage by militants in northern Syria, and thanks to the efforts of the Navy Seals, is eventually returned home unharmed. Evidence from the incident suggests US citizen Kyle Nasry was connected to the kidnapping, but when the agents trace Nasry to a rally held by a controversial imam, they are surprised to find Sarah among the attendees. Meanwhile, DiNozzo finally takes his relationship with Zoe Keates public - surprising none of his colleagues. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Mike & Molly
programme.desc: The Princess and the Troll. It's Valentine's Day and Molly decides to play Cupid after she hears Harry's tragic break-up story at O.A. Molly decides she's going to set Harry up with Victoria. Despite Mike telling Molly that Victoria will never go for it, Molly convinces her sister that she deserves to go out with a nice guy and Victoria agrees to the date. Mike gets Harry prepared for his date, but when the big night arrives, Harry gets cold feet because he's afraid of screwing things up and getting hurt again. Meanwhile, Carl and Samuel go to the Laundromat to pick up lonely, single women(n)

programme.title: Mike & Molly
programme.desc: Mike the Tease. After Molly finds out from her doctor that she is healthy and fertile, Mike starts to worry that he may be the reason why they're not pregnant yet. Carl tries to convince Mike to go get his sperm checked, but Mike refuses. After Mike finds out that his Dad had a low sperm count though, it sends him running for the fertility clinic, afraid that Molly will leave him if he can't give her a baby. Meanwhile, Vince tries to earn his keep by becoming a door-to-door vacuum cleaner salesman(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Burning Beekeeper. Lily asks for her father's help when she and Marshall decide to throw a housewarming party; Marshall's boss gets under Ted's skin and the two nearly come to blows; and Barney puts the moves on a wacky divorcée(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Drunk Train. ­Barney persuades Ted to travel with him on the 'drunk train', the last train at night from Manhattan to Long Island, where there are many opportunities to pick up women. However, Ted soon realises that Barney's conspicuous lack of success with the ladies indicates that he actually has genuine feelings for Quinn, a girl he recently dated. Robin and Kevin join Marshall and Lily for a couples' weekend away, but is their relationship destined to make it to the next level?(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: No Pressure. ­Ted tells Robin that he loves her just as she is setting off on her trip to Russia. He suggests that they start dating again and she promises she will give him an answer on her return. Lily and Marshall try to influence the outcome of the situation because they've had a bet with each other about how long Ted and Robin's relationship will last. Meanwhile, Barney makes a discovery about Marshall and Lily when he starts prying into their sex life(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Karma. ­Barney can't stop thinking about Quinn and tracks her down at the strip club where she works. After she gets a lot of money out of him in tips, he realises that she is manipulating him and feels this is payback time for the way he has treated women in the past. Ted is still upset about Robin moving out and can't work out what to do with her old room, while Marshall and Lily try to convert Robin into a suburbanite when she stays with them on Long Island(n)

programme.title: Taken 3
programme.desc: Former covert operative Bryan Mills (Liam Neeson) must race to protect his daughter while tracking down the criminals who framed him for killing his wife in the adrenaline -fueled third chapter of the Taken saga. Bryan and his ex-wife Lenore (Famke Janssen) are taking their first tentative steps toward reconciliation when she is viciously murdered, and he is targeted as the prime suspect. Now, with the CIA, FBI, and every cop in the country hot on his trail, Bryan realizes that it's only a matter of time before his enemies get to his daughter Kim (Maggie Grace), too. Determined to keep her alive at any cost, he realizes that his only hope for saving her is to clear his name before he is captured. But while Bryan does possess the "particular set of skills" to stay one step ahead of the men who want his entire family dead, proving that he's innocent of murder and seeing that the real killers face justice might be the last thing he ever does(n)

programme.desc: Trilogy Time. When Barney and Quinn start living together, Barney's reluctance to throw out any of his old possessions makes the gang doubt his faith in the relationship. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Apu. Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) makes his regular daily stop at the Kwik-E-Mart to discover they're having a sale on luncheon meat. Homer immediately buys the meat and wolfs it down, only to discover Apu (voice of Hank Azaria) was selling the meat cheaply because it was spoiled and out of date. Homer gets terribly sick, and at the urging of his daughter Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith), he takes part in a TV news program's undercover investigation. Apu's underhanded back-dating practices are revealed, and he loses his longtime job at the Kwik-E-Mart. After actor James Woods takes over Apu's job as he researches a film role, Apu moves into the Simpson home to make amends for poisoning Homer. While Apu becomes a part of the family, the Kwik-E-Mart is in his blood, and so he journeys to India (with Homer in tow) to appeal his case with the spiritually enlightened president of the Kwik-E-Mart corporation. "Homer and Apu" first aired on February 10, 1994(n)

programme.title: Hercules
programme.desc: The mighty ancient Greek hero, created by the gods to be the strongest man in the world, sets out to rescue a princess from an evil wizard. However, the sorcerer has created deadly mechanical monsters to prevent his plans being thwarted. Fantasy adventure, starring Lou Ferrigno, Sybil Danning and Brad Harris.(n)

Animated fantasy, with the voices of Lucy O'Connell, David Rawle and Brendan Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Lorax
programme.desc: A boy leaves his urban home in search of a real tree, and meets the reclusive industrialist who first created the city. The hermit tells the story of a grumpy forest creature who tried to stop him destroying the trees, and inspires the youngster to undo the damage that has been done. Animated fantasy based on the children's book, with the voices of Danny DeVito, Zac Efron and Ed Helms.(n)

programme.title: Short Circuit
programme.desc: A military robot is struck by lightning and develops a mind of its own. The machine embarks on a series of comic misadventures, but the company that made him want him back. He realises his only hope is to convince the scientist who invented him that he really is alive. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Steve Guttenberg, Ally Sheedy and Fisher Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: A struggling actor's ambitious, no-nonsense wife throws him out and demands a divorce. Desperate to spend time with his children, he puts his talents to good use by donning drag and posing as a Scottish housekeeper to get a job looking after them. Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Sally Field, Pierce Brosnan, Harvey Fierstein and Mara Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me
programme.desc: Four magicians use their lavish stage shows as cover for a series of seemingly impossible heists, and give away the money they steal to their audiences. An FBI agent assembles a team of experts to discover how the baffling robberies are committed and what the secret agenda behind the crime spree is. Crime thriller, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Woody Harrelson and Isla Fisher.(n)

programme.desc: Criminals hijack a crowded New York subway train and threaten to start shooting the passengers unless a $10million ransom is paid in one hour. However, the transport supervisor they issue their demands to begins to suspect the plot is part of an even grander scheme. Tony Scott's thriller remake, with Denzel Washington and John Travolta.(n)

However, he soon has to contend with a disgruntled scriptwriter's revenge plot, a suspicious detective and the ambition of a determined rival. Robert Altman's Hollywood satire, starring Tim Robbins, Greta Scacchi, Whoopi Goldberg and Richard E Grant, as well as a host of stars playing themselves in cameo appearances.(n)

Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri checks out the food scene in Cuba, including a Soviet establishment serving authentic Russian fare.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: In Iceland's capital city, Paul bakes using volcanic geothermal energy, meets food writer Eva Laufey, and creates two of his own bakes inspired by Icelandic cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: Some sugary items in the first basket have the competitors wondering how to create balanced fish dishes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents two shellfish recipes for the weekend, Jimmy Doherty prepares his own charcuterie, and the duo try to resurrect the fortunes of a long-forgotten Sussex drink called huckle-my-buff. Their guest in the cafe kitchen is TV property guru Kirstie Allsopp, who rustles up one of her favourite dishes, the Indian street food pani puri.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Michael, the owner of Rock Island Cafe in Honolulu, is concerned about a drop in his restaurant's memorabilia sales. Charles Stiles sends in Mystery Diners and discovers the staff is using the restaurant for personal business.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When Angie, the owner of Cha Cha Cha Salsaria in Honolulu, hears rumours of an unauthorised boat delivery service, she contacts Charles Stiles to investigate. Mystery Diners go undercover to discover what's taking place out at sea.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie comes to the aid of Luis, a restaurateur on the verge of ruin, needing to take the unfocused staff and turn them into the winning team that Luis and his mother need.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.sub-title: You Can't Be Everything To Everybody.
programme.desc: Willie helps chef AJ, who is struggling to make ends meet despite his award-winning burgers and a commitment to pleasing his customers.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Visiting a Polish restaurant in Detroit, classic dishes in Virginia Beach, and an innovative diner in Vancouver.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits the east coast of Oahu, Hawaii, where the general store serves traditional dishes including lau lau stew.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a burger joint in Chicago serving umami dishes that prides itself on its Asian flair.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits an authentic Cuban restaurant in Chicago that serves family recipes like the fricassee de pollo.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a Memphis-style barbecue restaurant in Horn Lake, Mississippi, to sample their ribs, cheese fritters and burgers with pork rinds.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a restaurant in Boston that serves an Italian-themed seafood dish.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels around Europe and north Africa to experience local cultures through their cuisine, beginning in Marrakech, where he tries street food, visits a communal bread oven, makes a nomad stew and joins a family for lunch to sample Moroccan home cooking.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver seeks the authentic tastes of Spain in Andalucia. He makes paella for the whole town of Ronda, birthplace of modern bullfighting, and is taught how to cut serrano ham by an award-winning father and son team. As he joins in the local festivities, including carrying a giant statue of the Virgin Mary from church to church, he takes time to cook tomato salad with chorizo, pork chops with Spanish beans, and quail's egg with black pudding.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Swedish capital, where he tries reindeer heart at an old indoor market and catches a boat to pick wild mushrooms and blueberries on one of the city's surrounding islands. He also tries fermented herring, heads to the royal palace to check the guards' menu, and prepares gravadlax, blueberry buns, creamy mushrooms, pike perch and roasted beetroot salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver steers away from the tourist trails in Venice as he explores the gastronomy of the Italian city. He prepares spaghetti vongole for a group of local fishermen, is taught the art of the perfect risotto by Ruggero Bovo, samples prosecco and cooks a bellini with beef carpaccio. The chef also tries his hand at minestrone with vegetables before being joined by old friend Gennaro Contaldo to make a Venetian tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the villages surrounding Toulouse in the French Pyrenees, an area renowned for its artisan food. He goes truffle-hunting and prepares an omelette with the pickings, learns how to make bread in the traditional way, and joins locals for a wild boar hunt. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Greek capital, where he heads to the street markets for his take on the local fast food - souvlaki and kebabs. The chef then learns how honey is made, teams up with a cheese-making priest and milks a goat, and prepares a selection of recipes including fisherman's stew, Greek salad, pistachio and honey cake, and a tuna dish.(n)

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: First episode of Carla Lane's comedy. Middle-aged housewife Ria worries that life is passing her by and wonders if things will ever perk up. However, she is consumed with guilt on meeting new love interest Leonard, a lonely executive with time on his hands. Wendy Craig and Geoffrey Palmer star.(n)

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: Ria lies to Leonard about her age, while Ben and Russell speak to each other for the first time in a year.(n)

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: Ria decides that she should do something worthwhile with her life and goes for a job. However, husband Ben is not supportive. Wendy Craig stars.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: It is work experience day, but Bren cannot show the new girl a typical routine in the canteen because the new boy has blocked the front of the cooker with his ladder - which the bread delivery woman refuses to go under. Canteen comedy, with Victoria Wood, Thelma Barlow, Sue Cleaver and Shobna Gulati.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Jean vents her anger on the customers, while Tony considers asking Bren to accompany him on a trip to Marbella. Petula returns with interesting news, and Anita celebrates the second week of her relationship with Pedro. Victoria Wood stars.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren is so excited about her forthcoming holiday with Tony she even considers buying some new clothes, and while a forlorn Stan tells everyone his sad news, Petula gets a little hot under the collar in her caravan. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Julie Walters.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren has a bad day - a convict escapes in the fog on his way to Strangeways, the blood donor van turns up at the factory, and Tony's holiday photos cause upset. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Andrew Dunn.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The staff have a bet on Bren's chances of romance with Tony, but the hapless cook's past finally catches up with her and threatens to ruin any prospects of romance. Meanwhile, Stan is furious with Philippa for failing to save the bulbs from last year's Christmas tree lights. Comedy, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Thelma Barlow, Andrew Dunn, Celia Imrie and Shobna Gulati.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Twinkle and Stan spoil Petula's plans for a peaceful family Christmas, and a baby is found abandoned near the canteen. Bren's romance with Tony is ruined by the unexpected reappearance of her husband, and Anita goes away - but leaves her inflatable man behind. Festive special from 1999, starring Victoria Wood.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Profile of Julie Walters, using archive interviews she has given on various TV chat shows across the past three decades. Julie recalls her time at convent school, her long-running professional relationship with Victoria Wood and her successful acting career, which has included a stint in Hollywood. She also reflects on her struggles with her daughter's leukaemia. Narrated by Tmasin Greig.(n)

programme.title: Marley's Ghosts
programme.desc: When Marley realises her childhood imaginary friend Carly was actually a ghost, a new addition to the gang is introduced, but her attraction to Adam could break Marley's world.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Social climber Hyacinth indulges another of her flamboyant whims and decides she and Richard need a new car - but a modest three-door hatchback is not what she had in mind. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an `Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Part one of two. Geraldine's head is turned by a particularly charming newcomer to the village - played by Robin Hood star Richard Armitage - and it soon becomes clear he feels the same. Keeley Hawes guest stars, with Dawn French, Emma Chambers, Roger Lloyd Pack, James Fleet, Gary Waldhorn, Trevor Peacock and John Bluthal.(n)

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: The shop owner's friends accuse her of being immature, so she sets out to prove she can officially be an adult. First she looks after a toddler - only to find the lure of the soft-play centre just too tempting - and then hosts a dinner party for eight, where disaster is on the menu. Comedy, starring Miranda Hart, Tom Ellis and Patricia Hodge.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Del-Boy embarks on a new romance with Raquel, an actress he meets through a computer dating agency, while Rodney takes `Nervous Nerys' out for a burn in the three-wheeler - but as ever with the Peckham twosome, nothing goes quite according to plan. Christmas special from 1988, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Wood with All the Trimmings
programme.desc: The comedian sends up Christmas TV in a festive special from 2000. Guest stars including Julie Walters, Alan Rickman, Pete Postlethwaite, Celia Imrie, James Bolam, Delia Smith, Richard E Grant, Derek Jacobi, Alan Titchmarsh, Michael Parkinson and Imelda Staunton pop up in pastiches of everything from a big-band show from the 1950s to a Dickens period drama.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross joins the comedy duo for more sketches, including a parody of Silence of the Lambs.(n)

programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: Comedy spin-off from Republic of Telly following the lives of an unhappily married couple and their indeterminate number of children, character already well-known to the viewing public from their appearances on Republic of Telly. Eamon always spends the money from the trocaire box, so parish priest Fr Gabriel is keeping an eye on him this year, while Bridget hosts a Tupperware party that goes disastrously wrong when illegal condoms are delivered instead. Jennifer Zamparelli and Bernard O'Shea star.(n)

programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: The couple are chosen to be on the poster for the forthcoming divorce referendum, but Phelim returns home from America with some shocking news about their marriage.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: First episode of the black comedy written by and starring Julia Davis. Manipulative beauty salon owner Jill responds to the news of her husband's cancer diagnosis by pretending that he has already died, hoping to enjoy the sympathy for being a widow and seduce her new neighbour. With Angus Deayton and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: Jill continues to ignore Terry's phone calls and she invites Don over for a dinner of smashed prawns in a milky basket, but her plans are thwarted when his wife Cath turns up. Comedy, starring Julia Davis and Angus Deayton.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: Jill persuades Cath to mend her marriage by adopting an unusual scheme. Unfortunately, her efforts prove hopeless and she ends up throwing Don out of the house after a pair of lacy knickers are found in his pocket. Comedy, starring Julia Davis, Angus Deayton and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: Terry prepares for his move to St Willoughby's Hospice, where he expects to live out his remaining days, and Don tries to reconcile with Cath - but Jill has no intention of allowing the two to make up.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: After finally standing up to Jill and throwing her out, Cath decides she and Don are going to join a religious community, and an unexpected guest makes a surprise appearance at Terry's funeral. Comedy, starring Julia Davis, Angus Deayton and Rebecca Front.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: Jill moves in with Glenn after discovering he is wealthy and seems determined to make a fresh start - until her past finally catches up with her. Black comedy, starring Julia Davis, Mark Gatiss and Angus Deayton.(n)

programme.desc: Hyacinth learns the Barker-Finches had a local celebrity at their barbecue, and is desperate to outdo them with her own event - an `outdoors indoors luxury barbecue and finger buffet'. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.(n)

programme.desc: Hyacinth agrees to meet the Ladies' Luncheon Club's VIP at the railway station - but the assignment proves more difficult than imagined. Nigel Davenport guest stars.(n)

programme.desc: Passions erupt in Dibley when Geraldine plays Cupid in her efforts to bring Alice and Hugo together, and at the same time she receives an astonishing proposal from an unexpected source. Christmas edition from 1997 starring Dawn French.(n)

programme.desc: The villagers set up a radio station to mark the 650th anniversary of St Barnabus's Church. While Alice tries to impress her future father-in-law, Frank makes a startling admission on his show.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Geraldine rockets to stardom following an appearance on Terry Wogan's radio show, but finds fame something of a bugbear. Meanwhile, the Dibley Gala organisers prepare for a knockout performance. Guest starring former ballerina Darcey Bussell, with Dawn French and Gary Waldhorn.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Alice shocks Geraldine with a monumental pre-wedding revelation, and the irreverent vicar is pleasantly surprised by David's dashing brother. Comedy, guest starring Clive Mantle, with Dawn French and Emma Chambers.(n)

programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage.(n)

programme.title: A Cook Abroad
programme.sub-title: A Cook Abroad: Monica Galetti's France.
programme.desc: The MasterChef: The Professionals judge embarks on a culinary road trip through the Jura region of eastern France, spending time with the area's food producers to see how their passion translates into world-class ingredients. She joins a boar hunt and faces up to the responsibility of eating meat, learns the secret of making some of the UK's favourite French cheeses and discovers an ancient profession she never knew existed. Finally, on the slopes of Mont d'Or, Monica prepares a rustic feast using produce she gathered herself.(n)

programme.title: A Cook Abroad
programme.sub-title: A Cook Abroad: Rick Stein's Australia.
programme.desc: The chef goes on a culinary tour of Australia, which he fell in love with on his first visit at the age of 19 and where he now spends part of the year at his home in Mollymook, New South Wales. At Botany Bay - the site of James Cook's first landing - he does some foraging and learns the art of cooking the Aboriginal way, before heading to the state of Tasmania. There he goes hunting for wallaby, samples one of the best single malt whiskies in the world and tastes sustainably farmed salmon that has become a national obsession.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's Brittany
programme.desc: The chef travels to France to retrace the journey he made as a student. In the first edition, he is joined by cooking duo the Hairy Bikers, and visits the market at Concarneau to source seafood, meat and vegetables.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's Brittany

programme.title: A Cook Abroad
programme.sub-title: A Cook Abroad: Monica Galetti's France.
programme.desc: The MasterChef: The Professionals judge embarks on a culinary road trip through the Jura region of eastern France, spending time with the area's food producers to see how their passion translates into world-class ingredients. She joins a boar hunt and faces up to the responsibility of eating meat, learns the secret of making some of the UK's favourite French cheeses and discovers an ancient profession she never knew existed. Finally, on the slopes of Mont d'Or, Monica prepares a rustic feast using produce she gathered herself.(n)

programme.title: A Cook Abroad
programme.sub-title: A Cook Abroad: Rick Stein's Australia.
programme.desc: The chef goes on a culinary tour of Australia, which he fell in love with on his first visit at the age of 19 and where he now spends part of the year at his home in Mollymook, New South Wales. At Botany Bay - the site of James Cook's first landing - he does some foraging and learns the art of cooking the Aboriginal way, before heading to the state of Tasmania. There he goes hunting for wallaby, samples one of the best single malt whiskies in the world and tastes sustainably farmed salmon that has become a national obsession.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver studies the diets of the places that have the most centenarians in the world, before providing healthy recipes that can be cooked at home. In Costa Rica, he meets, cooks and eats with five generations of the same family, including 106-year-old Jose, while on the Greek island of Ikaria 84-year-old goat farmer Nikos gives him clues to the secrets of the locals' long lives. Back in the UK, Jamie creates a day's worth of nutritious and tasty meals, including griddled steak with toasted nuts and grilled peppers.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Nicoyan Peninsula in Costa Rica, where he joins fisherman Otto for a meal of freshly caught fish with family and friends on the beach. In Okinawa, an island 400 miles off the coast of Japan, Jamie joins a 74-year-old grand karate master to learn some moves before lunch, which features popular local ingredient sweet potato. Back in the UK, Jamie creates nutritious and tasty meals, including cheese and corn pancakes topped with smoky bacon and caramelised banana; fish tacos, and chicken and sweet potato cacciatore, with mushrooms, tomatoes, olives and bread.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels to the Greek island of Ikaria, where he forages for wild greens and herbs with local cook Tula, before preparing a healthy hilltop feast with four generations of her family. In Okinawa, Japan, Jamie joins local people for their early morning exercise and discovers the wonders of a local ancient ingredient.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is on the Greek island of Ikaria, where he helps 84-year-old Giorgios work the land and enjoys a lunch overlooking the sea, before visiting a Costa Rican cattle ranch where he eats black beans - a superfood packed with protein and fibre. Recipes featured include sweet potato, chilli, cheese and seed muffins, carbonara with smoky bacon, peas, almonds and basil, and smoky black bean stew with squash, peppers, rice and chili salsa.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: In Japan, Jamie Oliver harvests and eats seaweed - a superfood packed with immune system-boosting iron - before exploring Costa Ricans' love of fruit. Could it help to explain why they live so long? He then demonstrates recipes including baked eggs with cherry tomatoes and ricotta on toast, miso and chicken and mushrooms with wild rice, and prawns with vegetables and salsa.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver finds out whether wholegrain cracked wheat is a possible reason so many residents of the Greek island of Ikaria live for so long. He then heads to Okinawa in Japan to explore the secrets behind local fruit, vegetables, herbs and spices, and learns about the concept of nuchi gusui - `let food be your medicine'. Recipes include black-rice pudding with mango, lime, passion fruit and coconut, green-tea roasted salmon with ginger rice and sunshine salad, and seared turmeric chicken with hummus, peppers, couscous and greens.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: In Costa Rica's Nicoya peninsula, Jamie Oliver learns the importance of enjoying the simple things in life from a group of fisherman, as well as the benefits of adding fruit into classic recipes. On the Greek island of Ikaria, he discovers that adding a handful of nuts might boost longevity and in Okinawa, Japan, he finds out how locals treat food as medicine. Back in the UK, Jamie demonstrates recipes including pork and apple sauce, glazed carrots, brown rice and greens, Asian crispy beef, noodles and salad, and a healthy curried fish stew with a spicy kick.(n)

programme.title: Gok Cooks Chinese
programme.desc: Gok takes on some traditional Chinese dishes and methods as he prepares steamed lemon sole, Poppa Wan's easy Peking duck with pancakes and all the trimmings, and stewed aromatic aubergine. Plus, Gok gives the lowdown on his fool-proof rice.(n)

programme.title: Gok Cooks Chinese
programme.desc: Gok Wan demystifies Chinese dim sum, the selection of dumplings, steamed dishes and other ingredients, by serving up his own feast. Pointing out the importance of cooking with a bamboo steaming-basket, he then creates delicacies including chicken and leek pot stickers, chilli and salt squid with cucumber salad, pork ribs and black beans, and prawn and scallop moneybag dumplings.(n)

programme.title: Gok Cooks Chinese
programme.desc: Gok Wan cooks traditional street food, including lamb and cucumber kebabs and tender beef noodle soup. He then heads to Brixton, south London, for a dumpling-making race with Auntie Li, who is bringing real Beijing street food to south London.(n)

programme.title: Gok Cooks Chinese
programme.desc: Gok Wan finishes off the series by preparing a traditional Chinese feast. The centrepiece is a whole baked sea bass with ginger, spring onions and tomatoes, which is accompanied by twice-cooked melting pork and fragrant chicken wrapped in lettuce leaves.(n)

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: M. Night Shyamalan, the creative mind behind The Sixth Sense and Signs, wrote and directed this characteristically atmospheric thriller. The rustic village of Covington is a small town in rural Pennsylvania that is home to 60 souls. The citizens of Covington lead a quiet and peaceful life, but not without an unusual caveat -- terrible creatures lurk just outside the borders of the village, and the people of Covington have reached an agreement of sorts with the beasts, in which they are allowed to go about their business as long as they never cross the village's boundaries. However, this precarious balance is upset when a headstrong young man, Lucius Hunt (Joaquin Phoenix), decides to find out what lies outside Covington, and unwittingly invites the wrath of the creatures upon the town. The Village also stars Sigourney Weaver, William Hurt, Adrien Brody, Judy Greer, and Bryce Dallas Howard; both Kirsten Dunst and Ashton Kutcher were at one time attached to the project, but both left the cast before filming began(n)

programme.title: 2017 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony
programme.desc: The 32nd annual gala honors Joan Baez, Electric Light Orchestra, Journey, Pearl Jam, Tupac Shakur and Yes, and Nile Rodgers receives the Award for Musical Excellence. Taped April 7, 2017, in Brooklyn at the Barclays Center(n)

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Starring Nicolas Cage, Sam Rockwell and Alison Lohman. Directed by Ridley Scott. programme.desc: An old-fashioned cop emerges to foil a high-tech attack on the country's computer infrastructure as Bruce Willis brings back one of the biggest action franchises in screen history. It's been over a decade since audiences last saw New York cop John McClane (Willis), but now, as the world's greatest criminal mastermind (Timothy Olyphant) attempts to cripple the entire country with an innovative act of technological terrorism, only one cop can insure that the integrity of the system stays intact. In this, the fourth installment of the long-running action series, Underworld director Len Wiseman picks up the torch formerly carried by directors John McTiernan and Renny Harlin to helm a script penned by Mark Bomback(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: M Night Shyamalan's end-of-the-world thriller begins in New York City with an outbreak of inexplicable suicides, which rapidly starts to take on plague proportions. As the wave of self-destruction spreads, people do their best to escape whatever it is that's causing it. Among them are Philadelphia science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) and his wife Alma (Zooey Deschanel), along with Mark's friend Julian (John Leguizamo) and his daughter Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez). Their initial plans to flee to the state capital don't work out, so they take off to the countryside, where they think they'll be safe. But it's not long before they discover that they may have made a bad choice..(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Animals.
programme.desc: Cats Part 1. Part 1 of 2. Rival alley-cat crews battle for control of the streets of Little Italy, where a young feline named Phil rises to the top of the pack. Meanwhile, a trio of owls celebrates Christmas(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Don't Be Ridiculous. Nora goes to St. Louis on business for the Department of Sudden Departure to investigate a possible scam that involves convincing family members of The Departed that they can see their loved ones again(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two adult sisters throw one last raging party in their childhood home before it's sold by their parents, with disastrous results(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: Peter is a composer and a likable sad sack who's devastated when his girlfriend of five years, Sarah Marshall, the star of a cheesy CSI-style crime show, dumps him. He weeps, he rails, he mopes. Finally, his step-brother Brian suggests Hawaii, so Peter heads for a resort on Oahu where, as he's checking in, he sees Sarah and her new beau, Aldous, a polymorphously perverse English rocker(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: Prepare for supernatural thrills when an immortal witch hunter faces off against the Witch Queen, who has returned from the dead, in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: Nine Oscars went to this drama about an injured World War II cartographer who reveals his affair with a married woman to his caring nurse(n)

programme.title: The Ties That Bind
programme.desc: A chronicle of the creation of Bruce Springsteen's 1980 double album, "The River," features rehearsal clips, outtakes, footage from the Nov. 5, 1980, concert at Arizona State University, and recollections of the writing and recording process by the Boss(n)

programme.title: The Wild Life
programme.desc: In this clever animated adventure, a restless parrot and his animal pals are shocked when a ragged human known as Robinson Crusoe washes ashore on their island. Later, they decide to team up with Crusoe to save their home from a pair of conniving cats(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Superman and Batman clash in this superhero movie(n)

programme.title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
programme.desc: Aided by a young journalist, a woman searches for clues about her mother, who died of cancer in 1951 but not before samples of healthy and cancerous tissues were secretly harvested from her and subsequently used for medical research for decades to come. Based on Rebecca Skloot's best-selling book that took 10 years to research and write(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Jamal Malik is one question away from winning 20 million rupees in the Indian version of the TV quiz show Who Wants to Be A Millionaire?. As he answers correctly one question after another, the producers suspect he is cheating and have him arrested. The police agents questioning him cannot believe that a slumdog like him can have the knowledge to win the prize and become a millionaire overnight. While trying to prove them it is destiny that placed him there, Jamal will take us back to the events of his childhood that have the clue to the answers. We will learn about how he and his little brother strived to survive in the mean streets of Mumbai and how he met Latika, his one true love. He entered the show knowing she would be watching it and now every question brings him closer to her(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: When the Cuban missile crisis arrives, Christopher Walken hurries pregnant wife Sissy Spacek into the huge, luxurious bomb-shelter beneath their backyard. A coincidental plane crash near their property convinces them they've dropped the Big One and for 35 years, the couple and their son stay put, with Fraser learning ballroom dancing, four languages and culture from Jackie Gleason tapes. Then comes the day he's sent out to find a girl (preferably one who doesn't glow in the dark) and he meets up with Alicia Silverstone, who's more than confused by his manner(n)

programme.title: Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas
programme.desc: He's mean, he's green, and he's doesn't like the Yuletide season one bit -- Jim Carrey stars in this live-action adaptation of the classic children's story by Dr. Seuss (aka Theodore Geisel). High atop Mt. Crumpet, the Grinch (Carrey) observes the residents of Whoville joyously preparing to celebrate Christmas. The Grinch was born in Whoville years ago, but was shunned due to his scary appearance, and his unrequited love for Martha May Whovier has turned him bitter; the good cheer of the Whos has been a thorn in his side ever since. Finally the Grinch decides he's had enough of all this happiness, and with the wary aid of his dog Max, the Grinch conspires to steal Christmas from Whoville, making off with their presents, holiday decorations, Christmas trees, and everything else used to enjoy the holiday. Molly Shannon, Christine Baranski, Jeffrey Tambor, and Clint Howard play several of the citizens of Whoville, while Anthony Hopkins narrates (taking over from the late Boris Karloff, who memorably read Dr. Seuss' story in Chuck Jones' 1966 animated adaptation of the story). Ron Howard directs(n)

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: M Night Shyamalan's widely acclaimed chiller about a boy who has the not-entirely-welcome ability to directly contact the dead. Bruce Willis stars as child psychologist Dr Malcolm Crowe, who is asked to help Cole Sear (Haley Joel Osment), who claims he can 'see dead people'. Crowe is sceptical at first, but - prompted partly by a similar case from his past, who he felt he badly let down - he's gradually convinced that the boy is telling the truth. Crowe believes that actively engaging with the ghostly presences could help both Sear and the spirits to find peace. Overcoming his terror, the lad finds that communicating with the deceased does, at first, seem to be beneficial. But then matters take on their own momentum, leading to one of the director's trademark plot twists..(n)

programme.title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
programme.desc: The 2008 sequel to the female buddy film The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants constitutes an adaptation of Ann Brashares' novel Forever in Blue: The Fourth Summer of the Sisterhood. Like the premier installment, this picture explores the seriocomic events that unfold one summer in the lives of four temporarily estranged friends as an extremely special pair of jeans works its way from one girl to the next. In one subplot, Lena (Alexis Bledel) travels to Providence, RI, and enrolls in a painting course; in another, Bridget (Blake Lively) embarks on an archaeological excavation in Greece; in a third, Carmen (America Ferrera) works on the backstage crew for a Vermont-based theater festival; and in the fourth, Tibby remains in New York and enrolls in summer courses. Sanaa Hamri, best known for her Prince and Mariah Carey music videos, directs; Elizabeth Chandler, who co-scripted the first film, adapts the Brashares book(n)

programme.title: Rosewood
programme.desc: A true story. It is January 1, 1923 in Rosewood, but in this largely black town built on family, faith and hard work, hopes for the New Year abruptly end. In a few harrowing nights, a white mob razes Rosewood into oblivion. As the rampage gains cataclysmic force, a heroic World War I veteran and a shopkeeper join forces. Dozens of terrified women and children have fled into nearby swamps. Somehow they must be led to safety(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor
programme.desc: In this romantic comedy, Chris O'Donnell plays Jimmie, the grandson of an eccentric millionaire. At the reading of his grandfather's will, Jimmie learns that he stands to inherit $100 million on his 30th birthday. There's only one stipulation: Jimmie has to be married to get the money. And he is going to turn 30 in 24 hours. Jimmie and his sweetheart (Renee Zellweger) have already been talking about marriage, but she thinks it's wrong to marry for the money. The Bachelor co-stars James Cromwell, Brooke Shields, and singer Mariah Carey in her acting debut. This story was filmed before in Buster Keaton's silent classic, Seven Chances(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Sophie (Amanda Seyfried) has one wish for her wedding day: to have her father walk her down the aisle. Now she just has to figure out who he is. Meryl Streep, Julie Waters, Christine Baranski, Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth and Stellan Skarsgard round up the stellar cast of this irresistibly charming musical adventure that celebrates mothers, daughters, fathers and true love to the rhythm of some uniquely catchy tunes. Based on the Broadway smash-hit and filled with the ABBA songs you know and love, the film will make you dance, jive and have the time of your life(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: Matthew McConaughey headlines director Jean-Marc Vallée's biographical drama centering on the story of Ron Woodroof, a Texas electrician who was diagnosed as HIV-positive in 1986, and who subsequently devoted his life to providing fellow HIV patients with non-FDA-approved drugs and supplements during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the devastating disease. Defying his surprise death sentence, Woodroof set out to procure any and all non-toxic alternative HIV treatments available, and established a "buyers club" to provide the treatments to others afflicted with the disease. But that mission quickly made him a target for both the U.S. medical establishment and the pharmaceutical industry, both of which resented his defiance of government sanctions, and joined forces to shut down his operation by any means necessary(n)

However, traveling by plane no longer becomes an option when he and a fellow passenger, aspiring actor Ethan Tremblay, are kicked off the plane. Peter, who ends up with no money or his suitcase, is compelled to hitch a ride with Ethan. programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: Your mind is the scene of the crime. Box-office superstar Leonardo DiCaprio stars in this contemporary science fiction action film set within the architecture of the mind. Written, directed and produced by Oscar® and Golden Globe nominee Christopher Nolan (The Dark Knight, Batman Begins, The Prestige), this eagerly awaited follow-up to 2008's billion-dollar blockbuster is yet another visionary tale from a startingly original filmmaker who continually raises the bar with every film he makes. Shooting in London, Paris, Tangiers, Calgary and Los Angeles, Nolan's mind-bending film also stars Academy Award® winners Michael Caine and Marion Cotillard, in addition to Juno's Ellen Page, Batman Begins' Cillian Murphy and Oscar® nominees Ken Watanabe (The Last Samurai) and Tom Berenger (Platoon)(n)

programme.desc: The audition stage reaches its third week, as judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, David Walliams and Alesha Dixon continue to travel the length and breadth of the nation to invite more would-be stars to demonstrate their unique talents on-stage. This year, the judges already seem to be eager to place their stamp on performers, as the usually reticent Simon hit his Golden Buzzer during the very first set of auditions, ensuring singer Sarah Ikumu advanced to the semi-finals, As ever, Ant and Dec will be on hand to deliver congratulations or commiserations to each performer following their turn in the limelight.(n)

With commentary from Jenny Powell and Kriss Akabusi.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: Larry's latest novel is being published in England - but his siblings do not seem to be very impressed, his mother is more concerned with baking food to sell at the market, and even his attempts to show off in a local bar go unnoticed. Louisa attempts to make it up to him by organising a public reading. Leslie overhears Pavlos explaining to Margo how he makes liquor out of kumquats, and decides to launch a business venture brewing his own - but his sister does not approve of stealing the monk's recipe.(n)

programme.desc: Officers from the force responsible for policing the two counties have to deal with tourists on the long sandy beaches of Newquay, high-spirited football fans in Exeter and people who have had too much to drink in Torquay. Narrated by Neil Morrissey. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ken and Steve are concerned that Tracy has done a runner with Amy to avoid the police, while Nathan charms Bethany into coming home with him after she has a chat with Mary. Elsewhere, Rosie and Sophie confront Gina over the vicious messages sent to Sally.(n)

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Family and friends attend the funeral of 11-year-old Rhys Jones is laid to rest, while a police raid at the home of Kevin Moody leads to the recovery of the gun used in the schoolboy's murder. Moody must choose between being labelled a grass and risking violent retribution or protecting the killer and facing jail time. But an unexpected result from the forensic tests on the firearm leaves the entire investigation hanging in the balance. Fact-based drama, starring Stephen Graham and Michael Moran.(n)

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small, while two celebrity teams go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Postcards
programme.desc: The actress recalls her journey around mainland Greece. She begins in Athens with a trip to the Parthenon, a temple to the goddess Athena built nearly 2,500 years ago. Joanna also visits a festival where fortunes are read out to large crowds, although the revelations are often quite shocking and rude, watches the singer Nana Mouskouri perform at the ancient Epidaurus theatre and ends her trip with a visit to the mountain monasteries of Meteora.(n)

programme.title: Fishing Impossible
programme.desc: The team heads to Norway on a mission to catch a king crab. The only problem is, they are the wrong side of the Arctic Circle, where crabs can only be found under the winter ice - so to catch one, they must cut a hole, jump into the freeing water, and catch one by hand.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a selection of comical clips filmed by viewers on their camcorders and mobile phones, featuring a bust-up between bridesmaids, fun in the kitchen and a talking dog, plus the regular mix of cute kids, below-the-belt mishaps and practical jokers.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Omnibus. Rhona and Pierce prepare to tie the knot, and Paddy gives the bride his mother's necklace as a gesture of support. While everything seems to go well, things take a darker turn immediately following the ceremony. Belle and Lachlan spend more time together, to Zak's concern, and Jai goes to the Narcotics Anonymous meeting in search of Nell.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Omnibus. Tracy is troubled by Amy's behaviour, and Sarah and Gary resolve to have it out with Nathan. Meanwhile, Peter tells Toyah they should put the IVF on hold until he's cleared his name over Ken's attack, and Dev and Aidan go head to head, recruiting opposing teams for the pub quiz.(n)

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents as Croydon bartender Tommy, prison officer Luke from Swansea, Essex-based salesman Bayo, and travel consultant Rixy from Leeds enters the `love lift'. All four hope to impress 30 single women and win a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval.(n)

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Game show in which contestants try to deduce everyday phrases and sayings from visual clues.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring everything from giddy grandmas, cute kids and crazy animals to below-the-belt mishaps, practical jokers and painful-looking accidents.(n)

programme.title: Mr Magorium's Wonder Emporium
programme.desc: The 243-year-old owner of an enchanted toy shop realises he is soon to die, so decides to hand the business on to his assistant, who tries to persuade him to carry on living. Meanwhile, an accountant who has been called in to calculate how much the business is worth refuses to believe in the store's magical nature - even as it reacts badly to the thought of losing its owner. Fantasy comedy, with Dustin Hoffman and Natalie Portman.(n)

This year, the judges already seem to be eager to place their stamp on performers, as the usually reticent Simon hit his Golden Buzzer during the very first set of auditions, ensuring singer Sarah Ikumu advanced to the semi-finals, As ever, Ant and Dec will be on hand to deliver congratulations or commiserations to each performer following their turn in the limelight.(n)

Comedy sequel, starring Sandra Bullock, Regina King, William Shatner and Heather Burns.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The Smiths plan a game night and Roger makes excuses about other engagements - until he is caught out by his lies and has to admit that he has been spending time with another family.(n)

However, convincing others that the end is nigh proves difficult. Comedy sequel to Bruce Almighty, starring Steve Carell, John Goodman, Lauren Graham and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve loses his girlfriend to a boy who takes her to a bar mitzvah, and decides to sabotage the occasion out of revenge - but things do not go according to plan and Snot is wrongly accused of being a thief.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris learns he is the heir to his grandfather Carter's fortune, but he refuses to take the money - leaving Peter to resort to desperate measures to keep the wealth in the family. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: Donna discovers there is a rat in the house and moves herself and the children in with her mother. Cleveland is left in charge of catching the rodent, but enjoys his time alone so much he bonds with the creature instead of killing it. Meanwhile, Cleveland Junior and Rallo play a game of spies.(n)

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: Donna decides to run for a place on the school board and keeps her husband away from the campaign in case he embarrasses her. Junior discovers he has a natural talent as a diver, but his chances of success are threatened when he is too shy to wear the school's tight swimming trunks.(n)

programme.title: In Loving Memory
programme.desc: Billy finds himself a girlfriend - but as usual the course of true love runs far from smoothly.(n)

programme.title: Goodnight Mister Tom
programme.desc: John Thaw stars in this adaptation of Michelle Magorian's wartime novel as Tom Oakley, an irascible widower whose life is changed for ever when nine-year-old London evacuee Willie is billeted in his cottage. The youngster takes to village life and the pair develop a strong bond - which looks set to be broken when Willie's tyrannical mother summons him back to the capital. Co-starring Nick Robinson and Annabelle Apsion.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica records one of her novels as a talking book for the blind, but a producer is killed while she is listening to a rock band in a neighbouring studio. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police leap into action when a labourer at the Kirkbys' farm dies of strychnine poisoning, believing a killer is on the loose. As the finger of suspicion moves from one villager to another, the scene is set for tragedy. Meanwhile, the Ashfordly Rotary Club pensioners head for the seaside town of Whitby - but David's mangy mutt Alfred proves to be something of a liability.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton tries to catch a thief who has been stealing tractors from farms around Aidensfield. Meanwhile, Vernon decides it's time to relieve a few more people of their hard-earned cash, and sets himself up as a horticultural expert and garden designer - but makes the mistake of enlisting David's help.(n)

programme.title: Forever Young
programme.desc: A 1930s test pilot is devastated when his sweetheart is left in a coma. Unable to cope with waiting to see if she wakes up, he volunteers to be a subject for a cryonics experiment. However, he ends up being on ice for 50 years, until two boys discover him. The youngsters' mother helps him adjust to the strange new world he has found himself in - and romance soon blossoms. Romantic sci-fi drama, with Mel Gibson, Jamie Lee Curtis, Elijah Wood and George Wendt.(n)

programme.title: Forever Young
programme.desc: A 1930s test pilot is devastated when his sweetheart is left in a coma. Unable to cope with waiting to see if she wakes up, he volunteers to be a subject for a cryonics experiment. programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Newly promoted DS Hazel Wallace returns from training to investigate when a man is found hanged - a case further complicated by the fact that, according to police records, the victim actually died a year previously. It is not long before Jack is back from his extended compassionate leave to help her sort out the whole sorry mess. David Jason stars, with Caroline Harker, Kate McEnery and Cheryl Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: As the Second World War continues to rage, Foyle investigates a pro-Hitler organisation he suspects may be linked to a mysterious death at the White Feather Hotel, while reluctant assistant Milner struggles to decide where his loyalties lie. Crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Anthony Howell, with Charles Dance and Maggie Steed.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate when the body of a woman is pulled from the river during the local Oak Apple carnival. Closer inspection suggests the drowning was deliberate - and, as the detectives find out more about the villagers, they learn the killing could be linked to the death of the victim's daughter eight years previously. John Nettles and Jason Hughes play the intrepid policemen, with guest star Simon Callow.(n)

programme.title: Royal Stories
programme.desc: Samantha Bond presents a documentary about the royal family, featuring rare archive footage and personal memories, beginning with a look at the Queen's life.(n)

programme.title: Royal Stories
programme.desc: The history of royal babies, and how they have gone from being raised in privacy in past generations, to becoming a focal point of the monarchy's public profile.(n)

programme.title: Prince Harry in Africa
programme.desc: Documentary following the prince on his return to the southern African country of Lesotho to continue the work of Sentebale, the charity he set up there a decade ago to provide care, support and education to youth affected by HIV and AIDS in Lesotho and Botswana. The film shows Prince Harry helping out with the charity's work on the ground and interacting with the local children, and captures the moment that he was reunited with Mutsu, a local teenager who he met on his first visit and with whom he has since remained in regular contact.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The discovery of a body in a shallow grave by the Thames prompts Brooks and Devlin to reopen an eight-year-old murder case, casting doubt on a conviction made by Steel at the time. When the imprisoned man, Luke Slade, is given leave to appeal, he represents himself in court - but what starts as a legal battle soon develops into a personal vendetta. Crime drama, guest starring Iain Glen.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin reopen a 25-year-old case when the bones of a young boy are found buried inside the wall of a communal basement. The victim's former best friend takes part in therapy to revisit her memory of the night he disappeared and reveals a shocking secret, but Phillips and Steel worry her claims will not convince a jury. Guest starring Keith Barron and Colin Salmon, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber, Freema Agyeman and Ben Daniels.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part one of two. Thrillers based on the novels by Val McDermid, starring Robson Green as eccentric clinical psychologist Dr Tony Hill. In the first tale, he is recruited by DI Carol Jordan to help track down a serial killer preying on men in the northern town of Bradfield, but his methods fail to win much support among the other officers on the case. With Hermione Norris and Philip Whitchurch.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part two of two. Clinical psychologist Dr Tony Hill continues his hunt for the serial killer preying on men in the northern town of Bradfield, but finds his efforts hampered by the local police's scorn for his unconventional methods. With only DI Carol Jordan prepared to believe in him, Tony must draw on all his reserves of strength and insight to bring the case to a shocking conclusion. Thriller, starring Robson Green and Hermione Norris.(n)

programme.title: Lewis

As Lewis and Hathaway eliminate suspects from a long list of the crook's enemies, the investigation brings him into contact with old flame Diane - who also happens to be Turnball's wife. Kevin Whately stars, with Laurence Fox and Gina McKee.(n)

However, the men celebrate the new arrival in the Skelthwaite Arms, but a power cut leads to a disastrous start to the baby's life.(n)

programme.desc: The actor ventures off the beaten track to explore the wilderness of the sparsely populated Northumberland National Park. After spending the night in a ramshackle hut, he meets 23-year-old Emma Grey, who has taken on the challenge of running one of the most remote farms in England. He also visits Kielder Observatory, a labour of love for bricklayer-turned-astronomer Gary Fildes.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team transform the garden of Kathy Mason, a Gloucestershire mother of two who has devoted her life to caring for others. Setting out to recreate the look of an enchanted woodland complete with a summerhouse, the experts plant hundreds of flowers and shrubs and try to shelter the area from the wind, but they end up battling the elements and wading through ankle-deep mud to get the job done.(n)

A culinary rivalry develops between Bert and Mark Bridge, the landlord of the Crab and Lobster pub, at Portwenn Fun Day, with both keen to take advantage of the event by providing food for the spectators.(n)

programme.desc: The duo are enlisted to design a memorial garden based on the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, but someone begins vandalising their work on a nightly basis. programme.desc: An arson attack on a Turkish social club leaves 17 people dead and Brooks, Devlin and Chandler fearing the crime was racially motivated. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: As the crime drama returns for its 13th and final series, Poirot finds himself investigating the strange and gruesome murder of an elderly psychiatrist. Elsewhere, the detective's old friend Ariadne Oliver is being pressed to uncover the truth behind two decade-old deaths. As the pair dig deep for evidence, they soon discover that their separate investigations are linked and join forces to solve the overarching mystery. David Suchet, Zoe Wanamaker and Greta Scacchi star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls victim to depression after failing to prevent the murder of a society girl by notorious art thief Marrascaud. His confidence shattered, Poirot eventually returns to work when a lonely chauffeur begs him to find his missing soulmate, the maid of a famous Russian dancer. The investigation takes him to the Swiss Alps, where, against all odds, he stumbles upon a hotel thought to be Marrascaud's hideout - leading to a very personal showdown. The penultimate episode of the long-running detective drama, starring David Suchet, with Simon Callow, Orla Brady, Patrick Ryecart, Nigel Lindsay, Morven Christie, Tom Austen and Rupert Evans.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: David Suchet takes on his final case as the Belgian sleuth in the last-ever episode of the long-running drama. Crippled with arthritis, Poirot is now using a wheelchair and has a life-threatening heart condition, but remains as sharp as ever. Calling on old friend Captain Hastings for assistance, he returns to Styles, where the pair first met 30 years earlier on a murder investigation. The detective is convinced the country house is once again harbouring a killer, and as guests fall victim to a mysterious attacker, he must summon the last of his strength to battle his ultimate nemesis. With Hugh Fraser, Anne Reid, Philip Glenister, Helen Baxendale, Matthew McNulty, Anna Madeley and Shaun Dingwall.(n)

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The impact of the war begins to be felt in Great Paxford as the women are forced to make sacrifices for the salvage effort. But soon matters on the personal front replace their efforts on the home front as Kate and Jack's relationship intensifies, Pat's marriage deteriorates and Claire finally plucks up the courage to ask Spencer out - unaware he is hiding a secret that could ruin their relationship before it has even started. Meanwhile, Alison resorts to desperate measures to pay a bill, and soon realises her actions will cost her much more. Wartime drama, with Claire Rushbrook, Daisy Badger, Rachel Hurd-Wood and Fenella Woolgar.(n)

programme.title: Harlots
programme.desc: Emily is brutally punished after Lydia catches her trying to escape, while Margaret is thrilled when Lord Fallon shows interest in Lucy, and Amelia's new friendship with Violet blossoms. Charlotte is also on the hunt for a new keeper and is determined to leave Howard, but events take a horrifying turn when Haxby discovers her intentions.(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: With the suspects in the murder of David Walker all having either a motive, opportunity or connection to the victim, Cassie and Sunny are left with a massive puzzle to solve. Cassie soon focuses in on Sara, whose alibi seems too perfect, as if it has been put together by an accomplice of the ex-prostitute - and the team is soon investigating the possibility of a wider revenge plan. Meanwhile, interviews with Colin and Marion's loved ones prove revealing. Cold case crime drama, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Badria Timimi, Mark Bonnar and Rosie Cavaliero. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Americans
programme.sub-title: The Magic of David Copperfield v The Statue of Liberty Disappears.
programme.desc: Martha is put on a plane to Cuba, and Philip spends more time at home, where Stan tells him about his work disaster. Gabriel is perplexed by Philip and Elizabeth's recent behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Sheridan Smith takes the lead role in Jeff Pope's three-part drama charting Cilla Black's rise to fame in the 1960s. As the series opens, Priscilla White is a Liverpool typist with dreams of escaping the office and becoming a singer. It looks like her chance has come when she meets songwriter Bobby Willis, who claims to be in the music industry - so she's less than impressed to later discover his flash car is hired and he actually works in a bakery. Despite this inauspicious start, Cilla agrees to let him manage her, but will their arrangement still stand after her friends, a local band by the name of the Beatles, help her land an audition with genuine impresario Brian Epstein? Aneurin Barnard, Ed Stoppard and John Henshaw also star.(n)

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Reunited with Bobby, Cilla's confidence returns and she once again dazzles crowds with her vocal talents. The re-emergence of impresario Brian Epstein then propels her career to greater heights, but this is quickly followed by a new low when her first record fails to set the charts alight, despite being written by two local lads called John Lennon and Paul McCartney. Epstein suggests a change of direction, persuading the singer to take a gamble on the ballad Anyone Who Had a Heart, against her future husband's advice. Continuing Jeff Pope's three-part biopic charting Cilla Black's rise to fame in 1960s Liverpool, starring Sheridan Smith, with Aneurin Barnard and Ed Stoppard.(n)

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: It looks like Cilla has put that early botched audition and those disappointing record sales behind her as, following the success of Anyone Who Had a Heart, her new single You're My World becomes her second number one. However, while she may have conquered the UK charts, can she follow in the footsteps of her old mates the Beatles and crack America? The signs aren't looking good, and just to add to the pressure, her relationship with Bobby is becoming increasingly tumultuous. But as her manager Brian Epstein's private life starts to spiral out of control, it seems there could be an even bigger threat to Cilla's new-found success. The concluding instalment of Jeff Pope's biopic charting Cilla Black's rise to fame, starring Sheridan Smith, Aneurin Barnard and Ed Stoppard. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories

Drama, guest starring Sue Holderness (Only Fools and Horses), Scott Neal (The Bill) and James Redmond (Casualty).(n)
